Reviews.Author: Brooke I.
Reviews.Content: One of our favorite neighborhood spots.  Kids love it. And so do I.  Fast, easy and affordable. Great flatbread italian style pizza.  Tons of different toppings that appeal to our whole family.  Pepperoni for my 6 year old.  White pizza for the 10 year old.  And we love the hot soppersata.  And the arugula and prosciutto.

Reviews.Author: Canny F.
Reviews.Content: They are vegan friendly! You can bring in your own vegan cheese. I'm sure you can bring in your own vegan toppings too! I ordered the no cheese pie, Centi Anini, with veggies and I was quite disappointed. It's not your average local pizza pie but I wasn't feeling the crust. I also ordered the Merilu pizza al metro with no cheese and a topping of arugula. I chose this pie because the honey and truffle oil stood out to me but I didn't even taste a hint of truffle oil. The sweetness of the honey was obvious but the truffle oil was drawing a blank. I like how the pears with walnuts gave it a nice crunch to balance the honey. I figured the pie didn't need sauce with those bold flavors but I was wrong. When I placed the order, he kept saying so it's going to be basically a crust with honey, pears, walnuts and arugula and I kept replying yes. I asked for sauce on the side after a few bites; it was free of charge and it saved the dry pie a lot. The sauce was surprisingly warm. Based on the pictures I assumed the crust would have been better - something similar to brick oven crust but crunchier. This small joint is so friendly! The customer service is amazing! They check up on you quite often and ask you how everything is and if we need anything additional. There's a limited number of seats so don't come here with a group.

Reviews.Author: Jill J.
Reviews.Content: pizza perfection. crusty, crunchy deliciousness. split 3 different slices with a friend and they were all super awesome. just a regular bacon slice--which was the perfect balance of sweet tomatoes and salty bacon. a greek style kind of slice--loads of veggies and really flavorful. and then some awesome mystery slice--there was ricotta, chicken, prosciutto (maybe)...i don't know but it was LEGIT. service was super friendly and this place is cute and clean looking.just a cute little shop that is worth popping into if you're near by.

Reviews.Author: Tanner B.
Reviews.Content: We stopped here after looking for a quick lunch and this place was perfect. Good prices and even better pizza! Lots of choices were available for slices and we left very satisfied.

Reviews.Author: J C.
Reviews.Content: We had spent time researching NY pizza and trusted Yelp to find us a place that would have memorable good food. This was not it.4 of us selected different slices and after finishing our meals agreed unanimously that everything was quite tasteless.  We were very disappointed.I don't understand the high rating.

Reviews.Author: Luna A.
Reviews.Content: Terrible customer service. The one who picks up the phone and takes orders for delivery is rude and unprofessional. I placed my order online exactly an hour ago and when I called, the woman on the phone said that she didn't see the order and it would take another 20 minutes or so. She also asked me with nasty attitudes: "so do you want it or not" duh...! If she had apologized politely instead saying I wanted the order or not, I could have waited patiently. I said I still wanted the pizza and what she said was :" I am cancelling the order" WTH? Why is it taking so long to get a damn pizza? Really? I hate the fact that I have spent so much money dining in that place. The woman on the phone clearly doesn't understand that a good customer care is a must for any business.

Reviews.Author: E T.
Reviews.Content: Sweet Jesus this pizza is GOOD.  Pricey, but worth it.All the pizzas I've ordered have been good, but if you like meat then try the "Triple Bypass"...'nuf said.

Reviews.Author: M J.
Reviews.Content: Margherita pizza is great! Good thin crust, and the sauce is really flavorful. Prices are a bit steep for pizza, but well worth a try.

Reviews.Author: Jam F.
Reviews.Content: The pizza is delicious if you order it freshly made. There's a difference between the ones sitting out and having to be reheated and the fresh made pies. It's a bit expensive but tastes great. A bit too pricey for me, so I'm not planning on going back anytime soon, unless I'm around the area, starving, and craving pizza.

Reviews.Author: Jocelyn K.
Reviews.Content: Not overly impressed. Really expensive pizza and not really NY-style either. About $4 for a tiny square. And I was still hungry afterwards but didn't want to waste my money on another slice because I would probably still be hungry after the 2nd one. The sauce for the standard margherita is kind of flavorless. Needed a lot of red pepper and garlic powder and I never usually put those on my pizza. Overall pizza isn't bad, but I've definitely had way better and larger.Although props to the crust. It's nice and crispy. It's probably worth more your money if you get a whole pie rather than a slice.

Reviews.Author: Steve W.
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, great pizza. Not many tables but the place was great. Would goBack again for more ofThe triple bypass pizza

Reviews.Author: R L.
Reviews.Content: Local recommendation given to us. A Sicilian style pizza place. Made to order. Tried the Margherita, pepperoni & triple bi pas. All tasted great! Big square slices. 2 were more than enough for me though husband & the kids devoured the rest. Small place so you may have to order & go if no seats available. Definitely give it a try if your in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany T.
Reviews.Content: This neighborhood shop has my favorite pizza in Hell's Kitchen! Merilu is not a drunk dollar slice place, as it definitely costs more than $1 but boasts fresh, quality ingredients in a cozily decorated shop.Their pizza is long and rectangular, with a lovely thin and crispy crust (which somehow does not get soggy) and boasts the perfect ratio of dough to toppings. Everything is thinly sliced and thinly layered, but will leave you satisfied without feeling greasy or inundated.I highly recommend:- La Fresca (fresh tomatoes & fresh basil)- Rustica (Italian sausage, onion & peppers)- Cardinale (fresh cut mushrooms & thinly sliced ham)- Catalina (the sliced breaded eggplant is paper thin and not heavy at all)- Wild Child (the ricotta is such a fresh contrast to the jalapeno)Whether it's for delivery, eat-in, or take out, you can rest assured that the quality of the food will remain the same, as each pie is made from scratch right in front of your eyes on a marble slab behind the counter. If you get it by the slice, it's most likely fresh out of the oven (less than half hour ago) and they will toast it again for you to ensure the right crunch for the crust. Definitely come here for quality pizza!

Reviews.Author: Helen Y.
Reviews.Content: Thank gosh the demands of my stomach are stronger than my appreciation for aesthetics. I walked into this place and was dumbstuck by pizza so pretty I had to admire the pies before I ordered. This is artisanal thin crust at its finest, with fresh quality ingredients and just beautifully made. The pies here are oblongs, and you get a slice that is squarish. Pick your toppings..mushroom, artichoke..when I went there must have been at least 10 different flavors to choose from in addition to the plain margherita. Everything here is cooked just right, to the crispy crust, to the sweetish tomato sauce, to the fresh mozzarella. You pay a little more but you are getting the best. For those with hearty appetites, it will be easy for you to polish off three slices. Merilu also sells Panini, salad and pastaThis is a small place, immaculate with exposed brick walls and not too much seating. So if you come at peak, be prepared to take your pizza to go. This is a family run place with the pride and friendliness that comes from good management and exceptional customer service. The lady behind the counter was the daughter, and pointed out her brother making pizza behind her. She was delighted I remembered her from the Yelp Pizza event in the Church on Houston St. My sis and I had been searching for the place that served up artfully decorated squares to the left and back of the church. After tasting the pizza here, I thought it could be Merilu. This is such a lovely place with great pizza and enthusiastic service, you will immediately recommend it to family and friends, as I did. Indeed after being disappointed by Sacco further up, I came here hoping to get my fix and finding it closed.

Reviews.Author: Supriya M.
Reviews.Content: Thin crust deliciousness at not so reasonable prices but pizza was fresh and hit the spot for lunch!

Reviews.Author: Scot W.
Reviews.Content: Glad I followed the other Yelp reviews to this place. Not at all the typical sloppy and greasy New York slice, the crust is basically a piece of warm and crispy Italian bread, the sauce nicely complements the toppings, which are all fresh. I'd eat more, but unless you're really hungry, a single slice will do you fine.

Reviews.Author: Adam R.
Reviews.Content: Get the tomato, it's so good. Seriously, I loved this place. I told the cashier that if this visit was going to be my only one during the Super Bowl, I was going to be really sad. I ended up really sad. However, I'm headed back for the draft. I hope I get in early enough on Sunday to go there. I hope you're waiting for me, I'm coming back!

Reviews.Author: Elicia G.
Reviews.Content: We looked this place up because we wanted real "new york pizza" we were not dissapointed. it's just a little hole in the wall but I watched my friend have a pizzagasm!like eyes rolling in the back of his head lol.staff was very friendly and the price wasn't bad for what we got. The fact that the crust was so thin just made it that much better, they were not skimpy on the cheese. awesome place!

Reviews.Author: Daniel W.
Reviews.Content: Love the crust. People working the counter were great. Food was well worth the 20 minutes for my pepperoni and chicken pie. Cramped seating. So best for take out and not dine in. Only a couple of small tables.

Reviews.Author: Selina S.
Reviews.Content: Maybe not traditional New York pizza but the pizza here is good! Have Tried the pepperoni (a little greasy), white pizza, and the margherita. All very good. However, the pizza is pricey and it's not really a sit down place, there are very few seats (it is a small suite).

Reviews.Author: Pat D.
Reviews.Content: I'd like to say the food at Merilu's is absolutely FANTASTIC.  They make the best homemade balsamic vinaigrette I've ever had.  Their salads are fresh and the square/oblong pizzas are the bomb.  It's not cheap, but when the food is good, it's almost worth it.  I said, ALMOST because, it's not just good food that brings about repeat business-- customer service to make or break your establishment.  Unless you're 'Dick's Last Resort' and then its part of the experience. So why the one star you ask?  Well, on today, Tues, 4/15 (yep TAX day) we placed an order (GRUBHUB # 58554487) for four orders of Polla Alla Parmigiana (chick'n parm) and requested angel hair pasta or spaghetti on the side for each.  ** Please note, pasta is NOT included with this dish, which is why it was ordered on the side.   However, when opening the chick'n parm, there was no pasta and after searching the other bags (salads and bread) there were no separate containers of pasta either.  See, I know it comes separately, because we ordered the chick'n parm the same way, just the week before, with NO problem.  I called Merilu's to let them know of the oversight and a guy that says his name was DAVID proceeded to tell me their chick'n parm does not come with pasta.  I explained to him, I understood that however I asked for angel hair pasta or spaghetti on the side.  The same as I ordered the previous week and I received spaghetti, on the side with my order.  DAVID becomes somewhat agitated and tells me they don't carry angel hair pasta-- **(stop trying to be RIGHT and LISTEN to your customer-- you know the little people that come in to order your from your establishment, so you can stay in business).  I repeat, I placed the order the same as I did the previous week and received spaghetti.  I think he finally heard me, but wanting to get me off the phone, asks me what do I want him to do about it.  I'm a little thrown back with that statement and I told him I just want the spaghetti delivered as soon as possible.  He tells me its going to take some time, and quickly corrects himself and says it's going to be a while.  He has to wait for the deliver guy to come back to check the ticket, and "who knows how long that will be."  I tell him I have the grubhub order number could he just check that, I'm repeating exactly what was put on the order.  He insists he has to wait on the delivery guy and it's going to be a while.    At this point, I become beyond just mildly irritated and asked if he is the manager and he tells me no-- "I just work here".   I state, "obviously, since this is no longer about the pasta, this as become a customer service issue.  Your tone as well as your lack of proper customer services skills are apparent."  Of course, we go thru 'who's the manager? what's the manager's name? etc.'  When I asked DAVID when would the manager be in, he says "he comes and goes whenever he feels like it." I asked how would Uciano, (that's the manager) feel once he learns what he thinks of his work ethic and of course DAVID proceeds to tell me, "I don't know, you should ask him when you talk to him."  I see this is now a joke to DAVID.  At this point, I realize I'm speaking with someone that cares very little for the establishment he works for and even less regarding his own employment.  He's probably bounced around from one restaurant after the next, with his insolent and rude demeanor.  Who knows who DAVID really is and if that's his real name.  He may very well have been the manager, and if so-- Merilu's won't survive if their employees take on DAVID's attitude in regards to their customers.  All it takes is one BAD apple to spoil the whole bunch.  SMHI refuse to spend my hard earned money (or my company's corporate expense) on a business that thinks that poorly of their customers.  Too bad, I really liked their homemade balsamic vinaigrette....

Reviews.Author: David C.
Reviews.Content: Merrily is part of the hipster restaurant row in Hells Kitchen. Cool hip tiny hole in the wall pizza joint and friendly young staffers, fits with the hipster foodie neighborhood. It clearly differentiates itself from the myriad of pizza joints in the hood by the only metric that matters, dope pizza!Here's the food lowdown: we grabbed three slices, each of a different pie; Marcilino - meat lover slice w bacon and ham. Two more classics, Margherita, and Mushroom. It hits the spot with some good quick eats. Especially when you're in a rush and don't have time to wait for the other popular sit down joints in the vicinity.

Reviews.Author: Nunzia B.
Reviews.Content: excellent italian thin crust pizza.....and they have gluten free pizza too... .the environment is very friendly ....I absolutely recommended. ...we loved it !!!!

Reviews.Author: Mike W.
Reviews.Content: By far the worst pizza I have ever had. A disgraceI am originally from Brooklyn so I know pizza. I have been living in los Angeles for last 7 years. I came back to Nyc for business and I was looking forward to eating nyc pizza.Boy I was wrong. This is the worst pizza I have ever had. Sbarro has better pizza than this place. I am positive they payed people to give them high yelp reviews. Almost no cheese on the pizza. Horrible cardboard crust. They barely heated it up for me. Any New yorker that thinks this is good pizza must be an upper eastsider. I took my boss who is from LA to eat here and he was so excited to have NYC Pizza and he thought it was horrible.

Reviews.Author: Nelson W.
Reviews.Content: While I hesitate just a bit in calling it the best, Merilu comes darn close to that when it comes to pizza delivery. The high praise and rating is definitely warranted especially after delivery was made on a nasty weather day. Not only was the quality of the pizza very well maintained, delivery came very fast in spite of outside conditions. Merilu is definitely on the pricier side of pizza spots in this neighborhood, but the quality of the ingredients are incomparable. The tomato sauce is amazing, and the thin crust was perfect. Do yourself a favor and join the big leagues. Leave the dollar slices where you found them, and order a pizza that will surely leave nothing but crumbs behind!

Reviews.Author: Kenneth N.
Reviews.Content: Now these guys have their act together!  Trying to order pizza delivery to my hotel, and as soon as i place my cursor over their Online Order tab, a pop-up message says "Online ordering not available at the moment".will try soon b/c of the 4-star rating.

Reviews.Author: Josh C.
Reviews.Content: Had a good experience. The workers were very friendly and were good to have a joke with. They came over to talk about Australia. The pizzas were very nice and great value! Would highly recomend this place to anyone who likes pizza and I will definitely go back in the future.

Reviews.Author: Kirk B.
Reviews.Content: Good pizza.  Not greasy at all and the ingredients were fresh.  Delivery was a little bit of a wait, so order early!

Reviews.Author: Heather E.
Reviews.Content: Not sure why people are so polarized by this joint. It's not traditional NY pizza. It's just good pizza!!  Love the Artichoke & Arugula and you can't go wrong by the eggplant. All delish!  Hubs and I ordered 30" for dinner and still had some for the next day.

Reviews.Author: My N.
Reviews.Content: Had their margarita and white pizza.  Their crust was delicious had a crunchy exterior and chew.   The margarita was my favorite had the perfect ratio of sauce and cheese.  Their white pizza I didnt like because the ricotta was not evenly distribute, didn't think eat bite was well balanced.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca B.
Reviews.Content: Very good pizza. Dough was nice and crispy, just enough ingredients on top. Large portion for the price. Not overly filling though, like your typical delivery joint's pizza might be. Not greasy. Had 3 different kinds and they were all tasty! I really liked sitting by the window/door - the whole front of the restaurant opens up and you're basically sitting outside. Very nice in the good weather!

Reviews.Author: Christina M.
Reviews.Content: The pizza was okay.  I got Margherita and Bianca con Spinaci slices and a minestrone soup.  The slices were both good, but not amazing.  The pizza was also very expensive ($4), and the slices were not large.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie Y.
Reviews.Content: Whoa whoa whoa, stop the presses. Their regular pie may be the best! I know it seems that I say that about every slice of pizza I get down on, but I speak the truth. They do lots of fancy pizzas from a ricotta white (real good) to a meat lovers dream (ok) that really makes this place stand out, but the king of the pizza hill goes to the regular cheese. Large, cheesy with the perfect amount of delicious sauce combined with high quality ingredients? Yes. Prices are a bit high for pizza and  delivery took forever, like close to an hour and a half, but it was a Saturday night so....I definitely recommend the pizza here and it keep simple: the regular pie.

Reviews.Author: renje g.
Reviews.Content: ++- Pizza is damn good-  Sauce, (slightly burnt)crust, cheese are all in perfect combinations- Inexpensive, small margherita pizza can easily food two, perhaps three if they're not super hungry- - Very small- You're going to be cold if you come on a cold night, with the constant door opening

Reviews.Author: Junaid H.
Reviews.Content: great pizza still thinking about it !

Reviews.Author: Kat D.
Reviews.Content: I'm not really sure why this place has such great reviews. My boyfriend and I were visiting from Chicago and stopped here after seeing such great reviews on yelp. Yelp has never let me down until today. The pizza tasted like cardboard with sauce. I had the 5 cheese pizza and all I could taste was the overpowering taste of blue cheese and this is coming from someone who likes blue cheese.

Reviews.Author: Audrey T.
Reviews.Content: Found this little pizza place on Yelp to take a pizza-lover. We were not disappointed!This place is small, probably fits only 10 people comfortably. Luckily we were able to grab a table. You order and pay at the front, then the server brings out your slices of pizza to you on cafeteria trays. While it seems like a hole in the wall sort of place, it's still nicely decorated - and sanitary. That's important!We ordered one slice of: the Merilu, Margharita, Mushroom and Parma. All truly very good. My personal favourite is the Parma (yay for cured meat!), but their Margherita and Merilu appears to be the most popular. The toppings seemed fresh, the crust thin. I could've eaten all the slices myself (but I had to share). Everyone in my group were super pleased with this place - glad I found it!Would we come back? YES, if we were in the area. At $3.50 - $5.50 per slice, it's not the cheapest place, but you definitely get good quality for your money!

Reviews.Author: Jason P.
Reviews.Content: Tasty, large slices of thin-crust pizza, excellent service, and good variety of toppings to choose from. Can purchase by the slice and ask for middle or corner slices.

Reviews.Author: Lindsey S.
Reviews.Content: 4.5 Stars! Amazing pizza. The perfect sauce to dough ratio. The toppings were savory and sweet. The girl taking my order was so sweet and explained each flavor descriptively, adding in her personal favorites. It was closer to a thin crust than pan pizza. I only wish it had a little bit more cheese :P

Reviews.Author: Karoline K.
Reviews.Content: I had the vegetarian pizza and the mushroom pizza. The ambiance is quaint. This pizzeria is rather small but adorable. The customer service was not the best. As a first time customer, I figured they would try and offer some advice or provide the specials of the evening. It was not crowded at all and I couldn't decide on what to get. Finally, I just asked the guy at the counter. He basically named the pizzas but didn't provide much insight. However, I unknowingly ordered a pizza with meat in it. Even though he put it in the oven to heat up, he was nice enough to not charge me and took it right out.The selection of pizza was overwhelming! The pizza pie is oval shaped. The slices are cut vertically, yielding two pieces, similar to a Sicilian shaped slice. The crust was perfection on both slices.I preferred the vegetarian pizza, it had onions, tomatoes and a bunch of other veggies. While the mushroom pizza was good but the flavors of the vegetarian blended extremely well.

Reviews.Author: Karoline K.
Reviews.Content: I had the vegetarian pizza and the mushroom pizza. The ambiance is quaint. This pizzeria is rather small but adorable. The customer service was not the best. As a first time customer, I figured they would try and offer some advice or provide the specials of the evening. It was not crowded at all and I couldn't decide on what to get. Finally, I just asked the guy at the counter. He basically named the pizzas but didn't provide much insight. However, I unknowingly ordered a pizza with meat in it. Even though he put it in the oven to heat up, he was nice enough to not charge me and took it right out.The selection of pizza was overwhelming! The pizza pie is oval shaped. The slices are cut vertically, yielding two pieces, similar to a Sicilian shaped slice. The crust was perfection on both slices.I preferred the vegetarian pizza, it had onions, tomatoes and a bunch of other veggies. While the mushroom pizza was good but the flavors of the vegetarian blended extremely well.

Reviews.Author: Jeff K.
Reviews.Content: This was a Yelp researched find. Glad I found it. A large Marcolino pizza, Chicken Parmigiana with salad and bread along with  several sodas and seltzers made the perfect dinner for the 4 of us. The sauce was smooth, subtle and just the right amount for my palate, toppings were plentiful and quality. The price for 4 was right, the staff was very accommodating and you can tell they care about your dining experience. I would walk miles to get a pie from Merilu's again.

Reviews.Author: Sean B.
Reviews.Content: I ordered chicken parm. Awesome.  However, I tried a slice of their Parma Ham with Egg thin crust pizza, and I ALMOST cancelled my chicken order.  The pizza here is that good!  Everything else(and I have tried them all) in midtown is Child's Play.  The ingredients, the crust, they are very friendly...what an incredible find!

Reviews.Author: David S.
Reviews.Content: Too dried out. When we ate there, at lunch on a Weekday, the pizza was bland even though it had toppings.  California has better versions of this style pizza, e.g., Pizza   Antica.

Reviews.Author: Adrian M.
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed. I tried slices or 3 types of their pizzas.  The crust was respectable but not great. The sauce was bland. Toppings were fine. S ok but not great.Service was great though, very friendly. Nice neighborhood place.

Reviews.Author: Amanda N.
Reviews.Content: Je t'aime! This place was amazing! Very cute little pizzeria with delicious pizza! My husband and I got the Pizza de Merilu and it was fabulous! Pears, ricotta, mozzarella, gorgonzola, all drizzled with honey on a thin crust. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: John T.
Reviews.Content: My first slice of pizza when I came to visit New York, walked a mile in 12 degree temp for this pizza after someone on the streets told me to try it.  Glad I did.  Although not the conventional round pizza, it was great.  Light and airy crust, good amount of toppings, not overly greasy.  Service was polite and helpful.  place looked clean, small, but clean.  Sat and enjoyed two slices and the counter guy was talkative.   This is a great place to visit frequently or when you get to Manhatten.  I liked it.

Reviews.Author: Yi H.
Reviews.Content: I ordered 6 x 15 inch pizza for a house party of 20 people, it was perfect.I host a birthday party at home on a Saturday night, I decided to order Merilu because of its awesome review on Yelp. I had no idea how many pizzas I needed for 20 people and called them asked. They gave me very good suggestion, so I decided to order 6 different 15 inch pizza and asked them to choose their most famous pizza for me, 2 vegetarian ones and 4 meat ones. We ended up having:- Margherita- Eggplant Vegetarian- Rustica- Prosciutto di Parma- Capricciosa- Jax-TexanI asked them if they can deliver the pizza at 8:15pm, they told me that they can probably do between 8:15pm and 8:30pm, which I thought was good that they managed my expectation. Besides, the lady was very helpful and friendly, she was really helping me to choose pizza. Our guests slowly arrived around 7pm and as time went by, I was worried that they would get bored with chips and dippings. I was looking at the watch and it was 8:24pm, I decided to call Merilu to make sure we will have our food soon and I was told that they are now packing the pizza, they should be out of the restaurant very soon. Then 5 minutes later, they called me to tell me that pizza are already on the way and I shall have them very soon, which I thought was great, I appreciated them calling me to keep me updated. When all the pizza arrived, my guests just dived in and everyone loved it. The quantity of food was just perfect, we only have 1 - 2 pieces left and everyone asked me where I got the pizza from, which obviously made me very happy. I highly recommend here!

Reviews.Author: Eric C.
Reviews.Content: I can't understand the high reviews for this place. I've ordered from here twice, once a mushroom slice from the counter, once a whole cheese pie delivery. Both times the food was just average. I didn't hate it, just nothing special.

Reviews.Author: Joseph P.
Reviews.Content: I tried it based on the reviews from this site. It's pretty good (I ordered a plain cheese pizza), definitely a pretty decent New York City pizza joint, but not quite as good as famous Amadeus which has a lower rating on the site. Amadeus just has a slight edge on taste.

Reviews.Author: s r.
Reviews.Content: The pizzeria is very cosy and inviting. Staff are pleasant patient and friendlyMaggie is very helpful and always has a winsome smile even when you change your mindThe pizza was awesome and we shipped 17 pies to Hawaii and needless to say we are enjoying them akin to hogs heavenEating here with an excellent ambience, compliments the sumptuous pizza. The sopresetta pizza was sublime and prosciutto was perfectly balanced and nuanced in its ingredientsNew York water versus bottled water would be a great addition :))

Reviews.Author: Kevin W.
Reviews.Content: Wow, a pizza place in Hell's Kitchen that doesn't suck.This little place is pretty unique.  15 inch or 30 inch custom pies ... or whatever "slices" you see that's already there.  It all sounds like a gimmick, but wait until you actually take a bite of the scrumptious pizza that comes out from the oven.The taste is pretty awesome.  Aside from the unique shape, which gives you plenty of crust (if you're into it), the pizza is pretty delish.  Just the right balance of crispiness, condiments, and sauce.  It's hard to describe here, but let's just say you get what you pay for.  There's definitely a premium placed on the price, but that's not deterring people from the traffic I saw in the store.  I tried a 30 inch custom pie (half pepperoni, half spinach white pie).  Both were divine and the taste fresh out of the oven can't be beat.The folks here were also extremely friendly and helpful with explaining the menu.  As for the size, my lady and I combined took down a 30 inch pie.  Granted we have a crazy love for pizza, but 30 inches is probably fit for either 2 really hungry average people or 3 moderately hungry peeps.  A 15 inch pie is not that huge at all, so keep that in mind when you make up your mind.Thank god here is a decent, unique pizza joint in HK.  As much as I like John's, I was sort of getting tired of the limited options here.Note this place is pretty small.  It sits about 10 to 12 people comfortably.

Reviews.Author: Alton W.
Reviews.Content: Decent price for a good amount of food. Split a 30" with 3 friends, and it was more than enough for us. -Rustica: This pizza was on point--mozzarella, italian sausage, red onions and red peppers. Flavors were good--better than I expected.-Pizza di Merliu: Wanted to go out of the box and try something different, so this pizza with pears, gorgonzola, ricotta, walnuts, truffle oil, and a bit of honey seemed different enough to try. It was good, but the the blend of cheeses were a bit too overpowering and made it too rich to eat much of. All in all, will be back.

Reviews.Author: Ala J.
Reviews.Content: I was just looking to get a halfway-decent slice of pizza near my workplace and what I found was this amazing little restaurant. There are literally not enough good things I can say about this place!!I could sit here and talk all about how excellent the food is but I think a hundred or so other Yelpers have that covered! Just get here and try it.If you're planning on eating in, expect an incredibly warm atmosphere for such a small, busy place. The staff here are super attentive, always welcoming, and the place just feels totally relaxed. Great vibes all around!The bottom line at Merilu is fresh, superb quality food at a great price, served by the friendliest people you will probably ever meet in Midtown. Seriously!Eat here and you will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Author: Marc D.
Reviews.Content: * Solid non-NY slice *Lots of good slices to be had all over the place in New York. When in the mood for a non-typical NY slice this spot fits the bill.  They do a pizza that is a cut above the rest.I ordered the straightforward margherita slices.  They are rectangular and cut off of a long rectangular pizza.  The crust was superb with a nice leoparding and wonderful chew.  The tomato sauce popped with a pleasant sweetness. The hand-pulled mozzarella added a nice cut above the rest touch. The thin strips of basil were fresh (I would have perhaps liked a bit more, but I nitpick) and balanced out the flavour.  Overall a very very pleasant slice.  Photo:  yelp.ca/biz_photos/meril…Service was also really friendly and they clearly take strong pride in their product.  I would definitely return!

Reviews.Author: Rima C.
Reviews.Content: Oh my God.  I don't know what Merilu puts in her pizza, but it is GOOD. Do try their garlic bread, as well. Warning: order delivery well in advance, anticipating about an hour wait time.

Reviews.Author: Aaron S.
Reviews.Content: Tasty thin pizza. European style.  Nice and crunchy. Good stuff.

Reviews.Author: Felix P.
Reviews.Content: 2.5 stars....in this place....You can pick....the thin crust oblong or the classic NY style....I chose the latter...the verdict....well it was indistinguishable from any NY pizza place. And the price was frankly, outrageous...17 for a large pie and 4 for sausage topping....welcome to NY! Is it any small wonder that 1 dollar pizza places are so popular?

Reviews.Author: Foodlover B.
Reviews.Content: Decided to try this place and Saccos, which are a block apart in location.  We wanted to gorge on NYC pizza  our first night after flying in today.We  loved merilu the most,    I had a slice with Italian veggies. The hubby, the spicy sopressa.   The crust is the perfect thinness/thickness.It's a simple place with a few tables but really nice workers.The weather was petty cold!

Reviews.Author: Lindsey B.
Reviews.Content: Really yummy pizza. I loved the thin crust. Super crunchy!! The staff was friendly. Coming from California the price was fair and the portion was generous. The place was a little small but cozy. I'd recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Author: F T.
Reviews.Content: We've ordered from here numerous times. Their eggplant pizza is beautiful in appearance and tastes delicious. No meat needed, it is very filling. That is my wife's favorite.My favorite is the buffalo chicken pizza. The buffalo sauce has the perfect tang, but the best part is a sweetness by the crust (syrup??). It's very very good.Great place.

Reviews.Author: Glenn C.
Reviews.Content: Tasty mushroom pie, very good spinach but the food in general was quite pricy.I'll give it a 4 for now, I'll try their specialty next time .Woman ws nice, drinks were overpriced like everything else.

Reviews.Author: Leo O.
Reviews.Content: Giving this place 4 stars because of the flavors of the pizza but 3 stars for the pricing.  Pizza should be a little cheaper.Had a soppressata (salami) slice and artichoke, mushrooms, and ham slice.  Both were excellent.  Fresh ingredients, flavorful tomato sauce and I would definitely pick soppressata over pepperoni.  The crust is thin which is nice.  There is some mild burnt flavoring which I was fine with.  I haven't tried their other slices but I've heard that their basil one is really good.The drink I like the most is the Black Cheery drink.  I'm going to buy some for myself now.I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Author: Michelle J.
Reviews.Content: The best pizza in Hell's Kitchen!

Reviews.Author: Cathleen S.
Reviews.Content: Merilu makes an awesome pizza. I've only ordered delivery, so I can't comment on the experience at the restaurant.  The margherita pizza is so delicious...and if you enjoy spicy get the hot sopresatta.  So delicious. The 15" is alot...the 30" is so big it won't fit in your fridge.  I think it is a great bang for your buck. A heads up...delivery from here takes awhile but it is worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Mark K.
Reviews.Content: It's hard to walk one block without seeing 99 cent or $1 pizza slices with loads of people stuffing their faces.  I can only hope that these aren't tourists who will go home and say "I had REAL NY pizza!"  Blech!On the other side of the spectrum is Merilu Pizza.  Here you can also get pizza by the slice (my preference, since it's easier to try different flavors and toppings) but you'll pay the price - anywhere from $4.25 to $5.00 a slice.Is it worth it?  Every penny.This is not your ordinary pizza.  The pie is long and narrow and the crust is thin but not paper-thin.During our visit, we had the Primavera (excellent combination of vegetables bursting with flavor), the Bianca con Spinaci (no sauce, sautéed spinach, house-made mozzarella and the most delicious, fresh ricotta), the pepperoni (very flavorful pepperoni), Hot Sopressata (topped with hot, as in spicy, salami) - excellent!Needless to say, the bill wasn't cheap but it was a memorable dinner.  Every bite was excellent and the staff was really warm and friendly.  I highly recommend eating there (although there are few seats), so you can get first dibs on what comes out of the oven.

Reviews.Author: Kurt N.
Reviews.Content: We wanted Pizza, and after our disaster at the day before's meal, we punched pizza within walking distance into Yelp and this place came up. Great decision.Good, authentic, italian style pizza. The slices are very filling and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Author: Travis D.
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for pizza and a coke one night after doing some shopping, and I would go back again if in the area and in a pizza mood!   The mushroom pizza that I had was pretty good, and I also tried my date's-which was very good too although I can't remember the kind they had. Worth a try though!

Reviews.Author: Richard L.
Reviews.Content: Me and my buddies ordered from here once for delivery - pizza and some rolls.  Then we forgot the name of the restaurant -but remembered the rolls were amazing.So fast forward a month or so - and we're online looking for the place when we eventually found it - 3 guys ordered 6 rolls -  a combination of all the rolls they had there.  Damn they were good - cheesy gooey insides with meat and stuff, and a wonderfully flavorful crust.  The Rolls delivered were cut in half.So here we go in descending order of amazingness:Stromboli - There's a reason why the stromboli has been popular since forever.  It's because the flavors compliment each other very well and it's just damn good!  Over here - you'll get tons and tons of ham, pepperoni and sopresetta.  The cheese and sauce is the right amount as well.  Sausage Roll - The sausage roll has just the right amount of onions and peppers and a generous amount of sausage and cheese.  It tastes good.  Second favorite amongst the bunch.Merilu's Chicken Roll - This...still good...just wasn't my favorite.  The chicken was flavorful and the size was good.  Eating this after the stromboli was a let down...anything after the stromboli was a let down lol.Lou's Chicken Roll - the problem with this roll - still again good - but not amazing - the fried chicken flavor was lost in the cheese.  So they fried chicken and chopped it up into the roll so the fried chicken was lost...oh well - still good, just not as good as i wanted.I would get the stromboli over and over again!

Reviews.Author: Abra B.
Reviews.Content: Oh how I needed a quick slice of pizza and was not willing to settle for just any pizza parlor. After Yelping this place, I realized quickly why it was close to a full five stars. First off, it's simple. You walk in, head to the back and select from what's out. If you don't like it, wait for what's about to come out of the oven and you're good. They offer normal bottled beverages, but allow you to BYOB. Quick service with fast delivery. The crust, sauce and toppings were delicious and you won't regret going here just based on the pizza alone.

Reviews.Author: Adam M.
Reviews.Content: Perfect square cut thin crust pizza by the slice.  After I left the U.S. Open last Monday, I was looking at Yelp for spots in Hell's Kitchen for pizza.  This little restaurant caught my eye.  It was around four and there was a portly guy with a paper plate and a bit of pizza -- just chilling in one of only several eating areas.  The counter person had a good attitude.The options they had on display all looked great. The Prosciutto di Parma really caught my eye, so I asked for two slices. The prosciutto was very delicious - it had that melt in your mouth sweet-salty combination that comes with primo "proshut". All of the ingredients were of note - the mozzarella was incredible (apparently it's all their own hand-made hand-rolled) and the crust is the perfect crisp/chewy combination.  The sauce was slight, but the expertly applied sweet-tangy balance which brought the very fresh Parmesan and arugula together nicely.  These were a pizza masterpiece - a PIZZAPIECE!  I wasn't hungry any longer, but I had to try the Rustica which was old school (sliced) Italian sausage (sausage with caramelized red onions and peppers) on a pizza.  The pizza was freaking magic.  This was the best possible version of a sausage bomber when considering Merilu's crust and sauce capabilities.  This slice had more sauce and it was completely appropriate based on the combination. I was in heaven.  I was a little sad that my hotel room did not have a mini fridge so I could somehow stuff a pie in it.  Thanks to Yelp reviewers for the recommendation!

Reviews.Author: Michael R.
Reviews.Content: I only tried the pizza by slice. It was good, very thin and light. I think I would've liked the freshly-baked whole pie better. Will try that if I get another chance to visit this place again.

Reviews.Author: Scott T.
Reviews.Content: Started our vacation here with a nice lunch and today before heading to the airport for home we agreed a revisit here was an appropriate way to end it all. So relaxed, so affordable and SO GOOD. After a couple of weeks of fairly extravagant, sometimes expensive and weird dining (think food malls in Flushing, Roosevelt Avenue in Queens), their inviting slices of pizza remain some of our best memories of the trip, and it was that memory that had us coming back today. Plus, the owner is pleasant as can be.We had five different kinds of pizza today along with cans of the Sanpellegrino blood orange soda and then went for the knockout punch: the peanut butter and Nutella "pie," more like a stromboli. Oof. That's a lot of food :).What a terrific selection of Roman style pizza, all expertly prepared with great ingredients and the tastiest bread we can imagine. Wish we lived close, we'd be regulars! When it says "As good as it gets!," we're in agreement with Yelp on this one.

Reviews.Author: Celeste Y.
Reviews.Content: Love the thin crust! We ordered a Rustica pie and it was so worth $33. The sauce and toppings were great. We also ordered a chicken roll and that's what brought the review down to 4 stars. I think it was undercooked because the dough inside was still moist, but apparently it was cheese? It was a bit too doughy. I also wish that there was more seating! Other than that, this place is great!

Reviews.Author: Amy S.
Reviews.Content: Gluten free margherita is more thin and crispy than the regular pizza, and surprisingly really tasty. $$$$ for all the pizzas-- not sure how it's been given only 2 $$, but it was very pricey compared to the other places (by slice and/or pie) that I've been

Reviews.Author: Rebeka B.
Reviews.Content: Pizza here is my favorite in the city (besides Forcella). Great prices, great customer service, and delivery is on time. Usually end up getting two pies delivered and freezing the slices individually for dinners - they are just as great reheated.Love their Margarita pie. Only annoying thing is that they arent open on Sundays (???) That's my cheat day!!

Reviews.Author: Adam R.
Reviews.Content: Pizza looked decent but I wouldn't know how it tasted. Ordered a large prosciutto pie and some salads for our family and we all say down while the guy said "give me 20 minutes". 20 minutes later he walked over to our table and said "we're out of prosciutto, want something else?". If he had told us this in the beginning it would have been no problem but they totally wasted our time and made no attempt to rectify the situation.

Reviews.Author: Carmen C.
Reviews.Content: Yummy. What a great find by my friend right in my work neighborhood. The area is packed with a myriad of great Thai restaurants and ramen shops, but this is a great alternative to a regular pizza joint. The pizza is thin crust, made with fresh ingredients (topped with fresh basil) and was just delicious. The pasta was to be expected by any other pizza fast food joint, so it's standard. Great spot to either dine in (though limited seating) or take out.

Reviews.Author: Whaledriving W.
Reviews.Content: Pizza doesn't get any better than this!

Reviews.Author: Amie H.
Reviews.Content: Tastey pizza with a by the "slice" style.  Fun spot, hip music, young, attentive staff.

Reviews.Author: Sandee L.
Reviews.Content: Don't let this little hole in the wall fool you. It's a hidden gem in Hell's Kitchen!The two of us ordered the 15" proscuitto di parma pizza.  It was fresh, airy and super yums.  I easily scarfed down half of the rectangular masterpiece, which had eight slices to it and still wanted more!  It was just screaming with simple, high quality, fresh ingredients.A great snack or light meal.  It might even be healthy...and if it isn't, don't ruin it for me.  Ignorance is bliss.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth L.
Reviews.Content: Had pizza here tonight, and it was delicious! Got the Sicilian slice with sausage, and the Margherita. I was skeptical of the thin crust, but it's incredibly flavorful, crispy, and satisfying. Ingredients are fresh, and service was very friendly. I was waiting for my fiance, and the lady working originally served me my pizza, then saw I was waiting so she kept my pizza warm in the oven until he arrived. We also LOVED the pasta with vodka sauce. Something very comforting about it -- the sauce was excellent, the portion was large, and it was only $10. Probably a better deal than the pizza, which is around $5 a slice.Strawberry pie for dessert. Basically a pizza with nutella and strawberries. Hard to dislike :)

Reviews.Author: Rob A.
Reviews.Content: Excellent place in hell's kitchen. It easily beats many of the pricy and fancy places in the area. It is small takeout...but has a 2-3 tables if you want to sit and eat there.

Reviews.Author: Vito P.
Reviews.Content: Walked in the freezing November cold to try this place. The margherita slice was fantastic and well worth the commute. The place is small, so if you can order for pickup. The Parma slice which had prosciutto on it was also amazing, though a tad salty. The service was friendly and the pizza maker was very nice! I would def come back to this place. The pepperoni slice was also great!

Reviews.Author: Travis S.
Reviews.Content: Shared a large pie with friends and it was delicious! Will definitely be back to try something with more toppings.

Reviews.Author: Bryan S.
Reviews.Content: I went in for a couple of slices with a friend between some drinks one evening (still relatively sober so that didn't affect my assessment...lol).  The pizza was pretty good, just know what you are getting.  This is what I would call a more "authentic" pizza with thin crust.  It's not the big cheesy slice that I expect from a typical NYC by-the-slice place.

Reviews.Author: Dianne M.
Reviews.Content: Best pIzza ever.  Thin, light and crispy crust with delicious toppings.  Just the right amount of sauce and cheese.  Could eat this everyday!

Reviews.Author: Jesus H.
Reviews.Content: Wow this is the best pizza ever...Extremely casual, fresh!I thought you had to go to a big restaurant such as grimaldi's to get a great pizz but I was wrong...this hole in the wall has the best pizza crust and ingredients ever....Great music, alternative, great people the guys that help you out are very service oriented. Pepperoni, margherita and cabrzze are amazing....any type!....The only minus is that they do not sell any wine...The pizza at merilu with a chianti would do the best combination ever!!!So small you could miss it on the street...It is a must if you are around times square or central park!Merilu should consider betting on huge success going big!

Reviews.Author: Santosh I.
Reviews.Content: Clean, inviting and cozy place with smiling reception and attentive, accommodating service... Fresh ingredients, pizza freshly prepared in front of your eyes, unique and great taste, appetizingly presented, reasonably priced yet does not feel cheapo. What's not to like? Thanks Yelp, for a great discovery!

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline K.
Reviews.Content: I liked it... it was fresh... but honestly, I have had better pizza in New York.  I felt as if it was a little dull, and I needed to add a lot of chili oil to my slices (though admittedly, I was very happy that they had chili oil... not too many places do).  The inside is really clean for a little pizza place, and I was a fan of the exposed brick.  If you're in Hell's Kitchen, it's a good bet.  But if you really want to scour the city for phenomenal pizza, hop on the L and go to Carmine's Pizza in East Williamsburg.

Reviews.Author: Francisco M.
Reviews.Content: Little hole in the wall with 5 star crust and pizza. Only five tables but great pizza.

Reviews.Author: Alexandra S.
Reviews.Content: I was in the mood for pizza and decided if I was going to get a slice (and suffer the caloric consequences), it better be the best darned pizza in the area.  Well, it was.  Yelp reviews came through for me on this one. I had a slice of the green pizza (with veggies and garlic) and a slice of the white cheese one.  Both really really good. The crust was extraordinary - toasty where it should be, thin and crispy yet not dried out.  Highly recommend stoping by!Price wise a bit high - and go figure the 2 slices I chose were the pricier ones but still close to $10 for two slices is a little much.

Reviews.Author: Anabel D.
Reviews.Content: I'm staying in midtown and craving great NY pizza.  After a reading reviews, decided to check Merilu pizza out.   Sorry to say that this was definitely a FAIL.  Keep looking and don't bother with this place.  Pizza sauce had no flavor at all.  Still craving authentic NY pizza.

Reviews.Author: Doreen L.
Reviews.Content: Did you see that teeny tiny pizza place next to Flaming Saddles?Where?! There!That's Merilu.Is it any good?!You betcha. Crisp square slices for around 3.5 each. Buy a 15" for 20-25. Well worth the money. Sweet sauce, garlic oiled crust, fresh ingredients. Is this the best pizza in Manhattan? No.But its an inexpensive, cozy, pizza place with paper cut hearts strung across the wall. Besides the cutesy decor, Merilu has a friendly cheerful staff: even the delivery guy was super polite and started picking up our mess. (Thanks for putting up with us while changing our orders a couple times. We are pickkky).

Reviews.Author: Ka Chun N.
Reviews.Content: Living in America, pizza has always been the dominant go-to-food for any occasion. My stomach has probably digested countless different varieties of pizza in the past, yet this place gave my stomach this special "sensation" that stands out compared to the nearest pizzeria around. Had Margherita pizza, thin no-burnt crispy crust, good proportion of sauce and cheese, and distinguished flavor. Overall, my stomach is happy.

Reviews.Author: Nichole Y.
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and the pizza was good but I didn't really feel it was anything too impressive especially for the price. $4 a slice is a little steep. It was fresh and I did like the topping combinations. I think I was just expecting something a little more after going off of the previous reviewers.

Reviews.Author: Kell M.
Reviews.Content: bland, bland, bland, bland, bland.I was so disappointed. So not worth $5 a slice.The pizza was fresh, tasted like nothing though. I did like the crust, especially after munching on no flavor a nice crunch feels like heaven.

Reviews.Author: Jason Y.
Reviews.Content: This is a charming little place, that serves 'flatbread' style pizza. We popped in here after some site-seeing near Central Park / Columbus Circle with out of town friends. Got some quick pieces of margherita,  rustica, and a basic mushroom. Crispy thin crust, tasty sauce that wasn't too sweet, and nice fresh ingredients. Something a little bit different from your everyday NYC pizza. What's not to like?

Reviews.Author: Matt E.
Reviews.Content: 4.5 stars...Surprisingly this little pizza shop has one of the best margherita pizzas I've had in a long time, especially considering they do slices. The oblong shape of their pizzas cut into squares may be very unconventional for a thin crust NY pizza but it's really all about the taste. The bright fresh tomato sauce didn't taste like they messed with it too much (a common mistake), the chewy mozzarella was topped with olive oil, freshly grated parmesan, and chopped basil made for a delicious and large slice, well worth the $3.50. The thin crust was crispy and thin but not too thin and was tasty enough to be eaten alone. The girl behind the counter was also friendly and a pleasure to deal with, I appreciated her asking me if I wanted an end or center piece of the pizza that she just finished topping. I'll definitely be putting Merilu into the rotation of great pizza places in the city.

Reviews.Author: Jad H.
Reviews.Content: Great pizza. The crust is so good and the selection is excellent. They have some tables so u can sit down and watch the street. Only negative is no washrooms. Will definitely recommend.

Reviews.Author: mina y.
Reviews.Content: The pizza was pretty good and I especially liked the texture of the crust. We had the margherita which was decent, and some specialty pizza that came with sausage, goat's cheese, arugula, and olives, a very flavorful combination. It's not what I think of when someone says "NY pizza" but that's not a bad thing. It feels more niche/exclusive, and I guess that reflects in the price. I did feel like I was paying a bit too much for what I got, and that I could have found something similar for cheaper in California. But hey, vacations are meant for splurging, and for a pizza, this was a splurge.

Reviews.Author: Marlo G.
Reviews.Content: Ohhh yeaaah! Thanks to the YELP app, I discovered Merilu which delivered to the Paramount Hotel. I had the New York pie which was so good!! And the smaller size was plenty of food for two!I ordered it with more sauce than cheese which is how I always order my pies, but every place does it a little differently.  While I would've liked more sauce, I would absolutely order again.  I actually would've gone to the restaurant and tried to, but it was a bit far.If you do order it to your hotel, please know you're gonna have to go downstairs and meet the delivery person. They carry Coke products in cans.

Reviews.Author: Amandeep S.
Reviews.Content: Walked into this restaurant after looking at reviews on Yelp. The pizza was great! Had half margarita and half buffalo chicken pizza. Cooked very well and great flavor. You could tell the ingredients were more fresh than other locations. I would definitely go back. For a larger sized pizza expect to pay around $35-40, but that was more than enough for 4 people. Only thing, I wish they had more seating. However, it is NYC, so I understand why seating is limited.

Reviews.Author: Ruggy J.
Reviews.Content: Stutting around Midtown and have a rumble in your tum tum? Whip out your Yelp App and twinkle your little toes towards Merilu!On a recent hang in the 'hood, I had this overpowering urge for a slice of pizza. Not knowing much of anything about this corner of Manhattan, the interwebs guided me towards this unassuming gem of a pie shop. It's not your typical New York style slice as it's a bit more Sicilian style than the typical thin crust action, but it packs quite the flavorful, hearty punch. Amore!

Reviews.Author: Angela K.
Reviews.Content: Style is thin crust but the pies are rectangular instead of round. This pizza is more of an Italian style than the stereotypical NY style slice. I've been told by a friend that lives nearby that this is by far the best pizza in the area. She said its pretty small inside and that she and her husband usually order it in. I can't speak of the restaurant space since we ended up ordering it in based on her recommendation. The staff were very nice on the phone and had no problem letting me substitute ingredients. Garlic bread. JUST DO IT! Really thinly sliced and heavily buttered/oiled. Ridiculously good. Garlic isn't overly intense and its has other seasoning as well. Really good value for $3. It is so good I easily eat a whole loaf by myself, order multiple! Pizza Merilu - Gorgonzola cheese with thinly sliced pears and walnuts. OMG this pizza is freaking bomb!!!!! I've tried similar style at quite a few places, this here it seems to be toned down by being blended with ricotta. The texture and slight sweetness of the pear really pairs well with the cheese. Walnuts are fresh, go surprisingly well too, adding just the perfect amount of bite/crunch. My boyfriend doesn't normally really eat Gorgonzola, pears or walnuts (individually, let alone all together! lol) BUT he actually really liked it! He didn't even get to try it fresh, he had it room temperature several hours later after I had mustered every drop of self control in my body not to eat it all, and trekked with the remaining slices from Midtown to Flushing, Queens back to him! Any pizza that can hold up beyond the 7 train deserves props in my book! Italian Vegetarian Pizza (I asked for artichokes instead of mushrooms) - It  was fresh, good, and very popular with my bf and girlfriends. I still liked the pear one a lot better though.Pizzas are about $19 for a 15 inch which is on the higher end for pizza but I definitely say its worth it!

Reviews.Author: Emily C.
Reviews.Content: Delicious pizza at a tasty price for my wallet! I grabbed a slice of the eggplant pizza and thoroughly enjoyed it. The eggplant was soft and went well with the pizza. You have the option of choosing a corner slice or inner slice & the slice size is generous and my hungry tummy was satisfied. Prices were good- a slice will run you $3.5-$5. Atmosphere was lacking and so was the AC. Not much of a restaurant but more of a you order at the window and pay upfront & then sit down kind of establishment.

Reviews.Author: Paul H.
Reviews.Content: Tip: no restroom! and $10 minimum for CC. Decor: 4/5Service: 3/5Food: 3/5Initially impression of the Margherita was "not bad". The crust was airy, thin and fluffy. The Margherita flavor was somewhat there towards the end. Overall at 2 slices for $3.50, it's decent and worth trying. I wouldn't mind trying their other flavors out.

Reviews.Author: Linda D.
Reviews.Content: I had the margherita and mushroom slice. Margherita had a nice balance of sauce and cheese a little bland, the mushroom slice was a little disappointing the mushrooms were sliced so thin the mushroom flavor was not prominent at all.Overall the pizza was good it hit the spot. I would probably go back and try another slice.

Reviews.Author: Lawrence W.
Reviews.Content: Best pizza I've found in Hell's Kitchen. Long, thin crust pizzas with fresh toppings, delicious sauce and homemade cheese. Literally all of their pizzas are delicious, you can't go wrong. Get what you like, the small sizes are actually quite a lot of food for two.Other things I've tried: Chicken Parm - Delicious, drowned in sauce and a great mozzarella cheese.Chicken Parm Panini - I think my stomach started to ache when I saw this thing! If you don't mind the possibility of having a heart attack from eating this sandwich, it's great. I'm fairly certain they pop their chicken parm onto the panini press between two slices of their garlic bread, more on that next...Garlic bread - So good. So unhealthy. Worth it.

Reviews.Author: Mike G.
Reviews.Content: We caught Merilu's just before they closed late night. They had some slices left so we took what they had and it was great! It's not all like the typical New York slice of pizza, it's true Italian style pies. Really great flavor.

Reviews.Author: Emile M.
Reviews.Content: Had mushroom slice and a vegetable slice.Their crusts are fantastic.  They are thin and crispy and fresh.The problem I had was the rest of the pizza wasn't very noteworthy.  While the ingredients were fresh the flavors didn't really stand out.  I think I would prefer stronger flavors in the toppings.  I didn't taste any garlic or other spices in a significant amount.Maybe I will try a different slice but I was a little disappointed by this place.Each slice was about $5, which isn't too expensive but isn't cheap either.  A slice is actually two small pieces.Overall their pizza seems not so well rounded with great crust but weak toppings.

Reviews.Author: Jenn C.
Reviews.Content: I love me a good New York slice, but sometimes I want my pizza a little more traditional, a little more Italian. Up until a few months ago, I would have to suck it up and wait until after work to satisfy this craving at lunch, but Merilu came and saved the day.The pizza here has super fresh ingredients, and each day they have different types of the long, rectangular pies - you ask for a piece and they hack it off for you, just like they do at my favorite bakery in Rome. The crust is thin, with the right amount of chew and crisp, without getting soggy. They will even offer to cut fresh basil on top for you. The toppings are fresh and perfectly prepared. Nothing is greasy or overwrought, and I like that upon each of my visits, they've had different types of pies - my favorite so far is the spinach ricotta.They also have a few rolls, and some sandwiches/soups as well (the sandwiches come on delicious looking ciabatta) and the staff are really sweet and helpful.

Reviews.Author: Janine M.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE this place... It's for people who appreciate fresh ingredients and attention to detail.  I think its family-owned and run, providing that extra TLC.  The pizzas are mostly made in a long rectangular shape but the round style is also available in the margherita.  I moved out of the neighborhood and I miss this place so always make it a point to visit when I'm in hell's kitchen. The place is on the smaller side so I would recommend take out or delivery, unless you are just looking for a quick slice.MY FAVORITES... Margherita (with toppings, Chix and Bacon is good combo), White Spinach, Marcolinos, Buffalo Chix (think Sunday Football) and Triple Bie Pass.

Reviews.Author: David R.
Reviews.Content: I come from a family of discriminating pizza lovers.  My father discovered this place first and immediately began singing its praises.  We went for lunch there this week and I must say that he wasn't exaggerating.The place is run by an Italian family from Brooklyn.  They are very accommodating and they treat you like you're in their home and they're cooking for you.The pizza was perfect.  We ordered a Sicilian style pie, half with tomatoes and garlic and half with pepperoni and broccoli.  The toppings are fresh, high quality, and actually have taste!!  The crust was medium thickness, light and crispy on the outside, and a perfect combination of doughy, crispy, and firm on the inside.  The sauce is homemade and has a perfect kick to it.  The cheese is REAL cheese, also fresh with a perfect consistency and the right ratio to the sauce.Merilu is among the best pizza I've had and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Author: Bettina R.
Reviews.Content: You know when you're out of town, and using Yelp to find places to eat, and your belly is already rumbling as you pass restaurant upon restaurant when your GPS finally re-calibrates, and you find out you're going the wrong way, and the whole endeavor starts to feel cumbersome and you want to give up? Don't.We could have stopped at any number of pizza places in lieu of finding Merilu, but what a travesty that would have been, because this was the best pizza I had during my brief trip to NYC. This place is totally no-frills, but as soon as I stepped into the tiny shop, the aroma of freshly baked (and slightly charred) crust and tomato sauce blew me away. My beau and I were both hungry, and figuring out who was ordering what and how many took us a few minutes. We wound up ordering three pieces, and while that doesn't sound like a lot, when the pizza came out of the oven, it felt like a feast. IT WAS SO DAMN GOOD. The sauce was flavorful, the toppings were abundant but not overwhelming, and the pizza sauce was savory with a hint of sweetness. And the crust. I'm a crust fiend, and I couldn't even finish it -- that's how much one and half pieces of Merilu's pie will fill you up. It was crispy and chewy and delicious. Really, this pizza bordered on perfection. I'd like some more right now, please.

Reviews.Author: Paulina L.
Reviews.Content: Really good pizza. Reasonable size for the slice, and the place is very welcoming. Would definitely return. Had the fresca pizza. Awesome crust

Reviews.Author: Andreas H.
Reviews.Content: I'm always down to try out a new pizza spot, and after seeing the reviews on Yelp, I was ready to give it a go.The Pros:  Quality toppings.  Great crust.  Amazing garlic bread!The Cons:  $$$$$$  Our pizza and garlic bread was about $45 with tip.  The staff was friendly and the guy behind the counter asked how I liked my crust (soft or crispy).  The garlic bread was also outstanding.  If I knew I was going to die tomorrow I'd come here and devour about 5 pounds of their garlic bread.  It's that good.We'll be back!

Reviews.Author: Alex W.
Reviews.Content: This is exactly the kind of place that can use a positive Yelp review -- a new addition to a crowded marketplace that distinguishes itself through good product and great service.The pizza here is tasty and fresh and the staff is remarkably friendly.  On my last visit, I was given a free sample of one of the flavors I was eying and it was nearly the size of an actual slice.  It's hard not to be charmed by pizza generosity.If you're into European style pizza with interesting ingredients (think potato and rosemary) and like your restaurant staff more smiley than surly, give Merilu a try.

Reviews.Author: Laura G.
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find a place that does simplicity well, and simple is good. My girlfriend and I discovered Merilu via Yelp (hooray for lots of stars and one dollar sign!), and it was a FIND. The first thing to know is that a slice of pizza here is not the normal slice of pizza that can you can eat in two bites - they're gigantic. We thought we'd share a few slices, and whoa - it was a full-on meal! You can see from the photos that they create a unique style of pizza, and damn - they really want you to have some. Not that there's anything wrong with that.As I chowed down on a slice of pepperoni and a slice of margherita with Italian sausage, I felt like I was in pizza heaven. The thin crust is perfectly baked, with that satisfying combination of tenderness and crispiness. Merilu also gets the ratios right. I can't stand pizza (especially thin crust) that is weighed down with too much sauce or toppings, but that isn't a problem here. The sauce is light and tasty, and even the Italian sausage is there in moderation, as it should be. And who doesn't love fresh mozz?!It's a small, modern space. I love that they serve the pizza on paper plates and the soda arrives in a can. The focus is clearly on the food. Like I said, simple is good.

Reviews.Author: fritz L.
Reviews.Content: This is some of the best pizza I've had in NYC.  I'd call it artisanal.  I know, a word that gets tossed about like legendary.But Merilu is excellent.I make pizza at home and this is better.Small with perhaps a dozen choices.  Don't miss this.

Reviews.Author: Vikram S.
Reviews.Content: Wow - finally a good pizza place in Hell's kitchen that stands apart from the other greasy stuff - The type where you not only feel good while eating but after you have eaten as well. The crust is thin and really good and as a vegetarian I found lots of good options. Also had two different soups so far and they have been great! The people running the place are also very friendly.They have a minimum($12? - I forget) for credit cards but that doesn't matter since the ATM is right around the corner(And the guy let me leave, draw cash and come back when I didn't have cash once.)

Reviews.Author: Jade L.
Reviews.Content: With all the great reviews, I was looking forward to being blown away by the pizza here.  I really wasn't.  It may have had something to do with it being one of the hottest days of summer and the AC at this place being broken.  A reheated piece of pizza was okay.  To be fair, I also had a piece of piece of my friend's freshly made pizza and it was better... but I was still not blown away.  FYI: It's a super small place with just a few tables.  No waiter service.  Just grab your pizza and grab yourself a seat.I may need to go back if I'm in the area just to give it another try.  As of right now, I definitely will not be craving this pizza though.

Reviews.Author: Victoria S.
Reviews.Content: The dough is crispy but still soft and the cheese is so creamy. This place is delicious!

Reviews.Author: Jen P.
Reviews.Content: Merilu Al Metro has the best pizza in Hell's Kitchen for delivery. I have eaten their Margarita Pizza (also with fresh garlic) And garlic bread. The pizza is thin crust (not super thin), sauce is tasty! The garlic bread is really yummy!

Reviews.Author: Andrew S.
Reviews.Content: Very nice little place. Excellent thin crust pizza. Portions could be a little larger for the price ($3.50-$5.50ish each). Love the open air too, nice touch. Music is good too. Friendly staff. There is a $10 minimum on card transactions, but the cashier was kind enough to accept my $9.53 transaction for 2 slices and a soda.

Reviews.Author: Amy H.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best pizza we had on our trip to NY. Crispy, perfect crust. Slightly chunky and fresh abundance of sauce. PERFECT cheese that isn't stringy but or even really greasy. Everything tasted perfectly together. Cute little space as well. YAY for pizza!

Reviews.Author: Peter K.
Reviews.Content: Fresh ingredient, decent crust. Definitely take it to go as this place is hot as hell and tiny. Just happened to be near this place when we were waiting to eat at Totto ramen. Would come here often if I lived nearby but probably not cross-town worthy. Nothing mind blowing but definitely above average, well done pizza.Fresh ingredient, decent crust. Definitely take it to go as this place is hot as hell and tiny. Just happened to be near this place when we were waiting to eat at Totto ramen. Would come here often if I lived nearby but probably not cross-town worthy. Nothing mind blowing but definitely above average, well done pizza.

Reviews.Author: Abby F.
Reviews.Content: Quick service with fast delivery. The crust, sauce and toppings were delicious and you won't regret going here just based on the pizza alone. Almost felt too healthy to be a pizza.  The crust was perfectly cooked.  Awesome veggie options.  I grabbed a slice of the eggplant pizza and thoroughly enjoyed it. The eggplant was soft and went well with the pizza. price are reasonable.

Reviews.Author: Pablo C.
Reviews.Content: THE BEST PIZZA EVER.!!! I would give them 100 stars.!!! . My son is a 3 yrs old Mr. Don't eat anything..!! And we were astonished when he grabbed the piece of pie and ate the whole thing..!! We are coming back.!!!!

Reviews.Author: Chad S.
Reviews.Content: When you want to try something a little different, not the NY slice status quo but still oh so good, hit up Merilu for a rectangular pie of flat bread Sicilian style euphoria. Fresh tangy sauce and even fresher mozzarella cheese on that Margherita. Crispy crust. Eat in, though this tiny storefront may be too crowded to accommodate, order delivery, or take to go, just eat it while its hot.

Reviews.Author: Allison M.
Reviews.Content: OMG! Let me start off by saying I don't even like pizza! But a friend and I came here after class (he was craving pizza and I was tipsy, so I said whatever). He had a Sicilian slice and I had some slice that had sautéed onions, garlic and parm...idk what it's called but it is THE ALMIGHTY JESUS! Ohemgee, that slice was amazing! The onions and the thin crust...*homer drool*. Not greasy, cooked perfectly, I can't even stop thinking about it. Needless to say, we ended up getting two more slices. And not for nothing, the Sicilian slice was amazing too! Remember, I don't even LIKE pizza that much, but THIS pizza made my dreams come true. Not even kidding. It's that good. Go get some!

Reviews.Author: Judy L.
Reviews.Content: Great thin crust pizzas. I'd recommend the ones that we tried: margherita and the zucchini pizzas. Someone there (friends of the owner or chef) asked them to create a dessert pizza: nutella with marshmallow and banana. It was actually quite amazing. But this isn't on the menu, so I'm not sure of its availability. We didn't have to wait, but most of the seats were taken by the time we were done with our pizzas.

Reviews.Author: Chris M.
Reviews.Content: I ordered delivery from Merilu based purely on Yelp recommendations. A pizza place that has more than 4 stars is pretty rare. I had recently moved into the neighborhood and this looked like an ideal place to get some authentic New York pizza for me and my relatives who were visiting from out of town.... boy was I wrong.We ordered an NY Pie with lots of meat and a Margherita Pizza with veggies. It was very pricy (about $25 per pie), but I figured it's worth paying for good NY pizza. The pizza showed up quickly enough. The slices were in disarray like both pies had been dropped, but were were all very hungry and willing to overlook that. After sinking our teeth into slices from both pies, all of us agreed we had made a big mistake. 1) The pizzas were dry. Almost no sauce.2) The thin crust was hard, burnt and tasteless3) The cheese was applied very sparingly and large sections had none at all4) All the toppings were fine, but none stood outThe taste resembled that of a cardboard pizza box more than it did a good NY style pizza. We would have been better off ordering from Pizza Hut or Dominoes. And that's saying A LOT. I would avoid this as a delivery option despite the perplexingly high ratings.

Reviews.Author: Sunny G.
Reviews.Content: This is undoubtedly the best place in the US of A to have single slice, thin crust, crispy margherita pizza...which literally melts in your mouth. Hats off!!!!

Reviews.Author: Rubun D.
Reviews.Content: This is a thin crust pizza (it's crunchy) sliced into rectangles, and will run you around $4-5 a slice.I had an eggplant pizza, a mushroom pizza, and a margherita (?) pizza. The sauce was not very flavorful, the crust was not mouth-wateringly crunchy (though, as mentioned, it was indeed crunchy). It was a mediocre pizza, and the expense drops it down to a 2-star. My girlfriend and I went to Amy's Bread for some carrot cake to make ourselves feel better about life. Yes, we're porkers.

Reviews.Author: Irene V.
Reviews.Content: Great pizza,thin crust,light,extremely tasteful.Everything that I ordered so far was great. Fresh ingredients.one of my favorite pizza places in the area.There's nothing negative that comes to mind. I wish delivery was a little faster but it's a small place that's very busy so it's understandable. I just try to call in the order before I get really hungry. Keep up the good job Merilu!!!

Reviews.Author: Aaron P.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful pizza!! Better than anywhere else I've tried. Friendly customer service and cheap! Definitely recommend to everyone seeking a quick meal.

Reviews.Author: Bibi L.
Reviews.Content: Visiting from SD and relying heavily on yelp for places to eat. We were starving and went to merilu's. We were able to get 4 slices to go in 10mins. Would have been faster except there was a short line. I loved that they put the slices back in the oven. The crust is like nothing I've ever eaten! It's sooooo delicious! We got a primavera, zucchini, pepperoni, and cheese. They were all mm mmm good! Hope we can stop by again before we go back home!!!

Reviews.Author: Mark M.
Reviews.Content: Pretty darn good...My wife and I had a quick slice here...we got the veggie slice, drizzled it with garlic oil, and scarfed it down.  Good crust, good cheese, and very fresh toppings.  More importantly, the staff here was super friendly and tip-worthy.Thanks for the food and courtesies!

Reviews.Author: Clayton A.
Reviews.Content: The slices here are more expensive than most NYers are accustomed to, but the slices (and the pizzas) are much bigger as well. I'd advise newcomers to order with caution upon arrival, as one's eyes can become overwhelmed by the delicious looking pizzas and easily over-order.I ordered a pepperoni slice and a zucchini slice, both of which were hot, fresh and rich with flavor. The crust was thin and salty, which I always like. The rest of the ingredients were good, including the sauce, which wasn't overly sweet. I must note that I was very hungry, and pizza has a tendency to taste extra-good under such circumstances, but this pizza was only good rather than exceptional. Thus, I give it the three stars. I'll probably try to go back and try it again and may update my rating, but as for now, this place is good, not great.

Reviews.Author: Sasha B.
Reviews.Content: DON"T GET DELIVERY!!!I ordered a large pizza and a salad at 7:20 last night. We were told that it would be 40 mins for delivery. At 8:15 we called and inquired as to the status and were told "It's on its way." At 8:30, we called again and were harassed for calling a second time. The employee handed the phone to who must have been the manager or the owner and she was extremely rude. She raised her voice and continued to have excuses and asked me why I kept calling after the pizza took twice as long as promised.She ended up canceling our order and I'll never order from here again. Go with Capizzi down the street. Better pizza and MUCH better service.

Reviews.Author: Wesley C.
Reviews.Content: Oh my goodness - we came here for our "appetizer" prior to getting seated at Totto Ramen! We almost decided to get ramen another day because the pizza was so good! The crust is thin and crispy, sauce & cheese perfect, and ingredients fresh. What else could you want for good pizza? And the owner was extremely friendly and personable - will definitely be coming back!

Reviews.Author: Vince L.
Reviews.Content: Ordered 4 pizzas slicesRankingsMushroom - 1stPepperoni - 3rdSausage - 4thMargarita - 2ndAll good though.  Fed 2 for under $20

Reviews.Author: Nick C.
Reviews.Content: Small place, Long pizzaAfter wandering around the theater district, Merilu came up as a place to go eat. Merilu is small place...there's 10 seats in the whole place. The service was okay...typically if you are used to New York service.And the pizza?...for a thin crust pizza it was very good...and then Merilu does hold its own because the pizza taste homemade..but don't expect to be blown awayDefinitely more of a date-hipster kind of place....it's not a fold a pizza joint.

Reviews.Author: Jack D.
