Reviews.Content: Everything is fresh everything is awesome. This place is worth the money for sure. But if you have a big appetite you will prolly wanna add some toppings cause I weight about 170 and I fly through 4-5 slices regular slices

Reviews.Author: Sara P.
Reviews.Content: You have to know what to order. I love THIN CRUST pizza especailly when there is home made mozzarella involved. The woman on the phone suggested I try the MAGOTO pizza which is like a margarhita pizza with some riccota, and i got it THIN CRUST and it was incredible, even the BF who is a pizza junkie said it was delic!!!!Love it!def must have!

Reviews.Author: Melanie S.
Reviews.Content: Just visiting NYC and wanted to eat some delicious pizza near our hotel. We looked up Merilu and decided to give it a shot, and loved it! The pizza crust is thin, crispy and delicious, and they have a pretty good variety. Small shop with great pizza!

Reviews.Author: Leslie H.
Reviews.Content: Delicious fresh pizza. I had the spinach white pizza and thought it was great. One con though was the pizza was pretty oily. I took my pizza to go to bring it back to my office and by the time I got back, my bag was soaked. Definitely got a few judgmental glances at my bag!

Reviews.Author: Chrissy C.
Reviews.Content: it's cheap and it's good. they have gourmet style pizza at $ prices! i wouldn't bring a date around here or anything (since it looks like any other pizza joint).  but, i would bring friends for a quick bite.  or a pie to take home.

Reviews.Author: Alice W.
Reviews.Content: We liked it, it's not on our top five pizza joints but we will definitely come back again for a fresh out of the oven slice.

Reviews.Author: Catherine W.
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a good pizza place and heard about Merilou's. Great atmosphere, good pizza, just like Rome! The margherrita was divine and homemade! Downfalls: service was scattered and limited seating but hey! Good stuff!

Reviews.Author: Rachel R.
Reviews.Content: Fresca: One of the best things I ate in New York, and all I did was eat in New York.

Reviews.Author: Punkie P.
Reviews.Content: I came here for a quick lunch on a weekend trip to NYC as Yelp reviewers said it was good... They were right!!! This place did not let me down. The crust was crisp and the cheese was not greasy... It gives New Haven style pizza a run for its money.

Reviews.Author: Steve S.
Reviews.Content: Oh no. Ordered tonight 4/15 from my go-to pizza place. I ordered the Magoto. It arrived and had barely any of the good sauce and was under cooked. Basically cheese on bread. What a waste of 23 bucks and crappy Sunday pizza night :( I hope it's just a bad one. I'll probably order again but it if it's a trend I'll have to keep this star rating.

Reviews.Author: Shannon L.
Reviews.Content: Authentic Italian family-run joint. While I wasn't overly crazy about the pizza, pizza is pizza and it's hard to screw up. My brother and I split a gigantic round pizza and hung out eating before a taping of The Colbert Report just a few blocks over. The girl working was ridiculously sweet and eager to recommend other places to check out while we were in the city. They have regulars going in all the time checking up on them and it's really cute to watch if you're into feeling slightly voyeuristic. Still, crazy nice people.

Reviews.Author: Cami L.
Reviews.Content: Great quick stop for pizza.Great crisp crust and good ingredients! We loved it!

Reviews.Author: Harry H.
Reviews.Content: Stumbled in here at dusk for a tasty and fairly substantial margherita for $3.50 cash. Satisfying product served up by a friendly staff in a cozy little WYSIWYG joint - dig it.

Reviews.Author: L C.
Reviews.Content: Maybe people who live here need to get out more. Because I do not think it deserves those ratings.  I've tried good pizza in Brooklyn at some more famous establishments and they are not even in the same league. Or maybe I'm not a fan of their dough and sauce. It's just average to me.

Reviews.Author: Mike F.
Reviews.Content: This is an extremely unique, superb quality & Uber-friendly family establishment.  I live across the street & have an Arts Festival for the neighborhood (HK: ArtiST), & Lucciano donated their sublime flat bread pizza for a major party.  Their methods & fresh ingredients are truly an old school artisan affair  They learned from the best, & the range of dishes encompasses top quality comfort food with cooking methods & spices so wisely chosen.  Would you believe that the marble tables actually are from the family stone work business, Granata?  The generosity in neighborly assistance even extended to offering help with our arts & culture magazine!You value pride of craft, local character & good will without agenda, come by or place an order here.  Whatever else you order, DO include the long rectangular "Pizza Al Metro".  The balance of flavors & quality is transcendent.

Reviews.Author: Jeff T.
Reviews.Content: Went to get dinner, sign said cash only.  Had to come back next day for lunch.Great little place, all types of pizza with tasty toppings and as most people mention a really good crisp crust.   Guys behind the counter are friendly as well.  I will be back for this again.

Reviews.Author: Rachel P.
Reviews.Content: First encounter: delivery by Grubhub on a Sunday evening. That first taste of the Pizza Rustica convinced me that we made a very good choice. We spiced it up at home with red pepper flakes and Sri Racha chili sauce, but it's still a delicious (long/stretch) pie. I look forward to round two.

Reviews.Author: Nicole C.
Reviews.Content: Great pizza! Magherita Pizza is a must!

Reviews.Author: Sara B.
Reviews.Content: Good pizza.

Reviews.Author: Wesley S.
Reviews.Content: I am so glad I followed my fellow yelpers advice on this one. I had not had fantastic pizza like this since Brooklyn. This place has an amazing pie. The crust has a nice sweet taste and is thin. I tried the triple bi pass (appropriately named but in no way greasy). I think I have found a new favorite pizza place. Thanks Merilu you have renewed my faith in New York pizza. Thank you for reading and enjoy.

Reviews.Author: Vincent Y.
Reviews.Content: Delicious, thin crust pizza. I would write more for the review but I don't know how I could. Not too much tomato sauce, not too much meat but just perfect in terms of portions (it was a big slice too). My slice was slightly burnt but I still enjoyed it aplenty. It's a small shop (maybe four tables) so be prepared for that.

Reviews.Author: Juaquin C.
Reviews.Content: Good solid pizza

Reviews.Author: Dave N.
Reviews.Content: eaten inside the restaurant and it's just a small place with not too much room...simple cozy eating experience...we primarily order to our apt.  I have to say that we have not had anything from merilu that was less than amazing.  the merilu salad we ordered on a whim, wow, it's out of this world, super fresh and the arugula is not overwhelming at all, the honey is a wonderful augment.the calzones (sometimes a pie) are what we typically order and they always arrive fresh and hot, and might just be the best calzone i have ever had...the rioctta cheese just gushes out when you cut in and they will throw in whatever toppings you'd like.  the dough, there is something about the dough - not sure what it is but wow...to the moon.if you order a pizza the 15" is plenty for two, the other size, is BIG.order the entire menu, you will not be disappointed...they continuously hit it out of the park.the folks on the phone and in the restaurant are always super nice and cordial, something you don't always get in NYC :)the freshness, the flavor and the deliciousness at merilu is just splendid, this is my number one pizza place i recommend to folks i work with or to people from out of town...

Reviews.Author: Matthew F.
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of the best pizzas I've had.

Reviews.Author: Josh K.
Reviews.Content: One of the best pies I have had in the city. Crispy yet shockingly flavorful crust. Amazing that it is a little take out (mostly) shack in Hell's Kitchen and does not have a mega cult following. You can BYO if business is light, they're all very nice. Try the artichoke pizza and if you've got enough people, get a whole pie and eat it right there. Gets cold fast though due to its shape so that is a plus for their pay-per-slice model. I love it, I'll be back!

Reviews.Author: Natalie K.
Reviews.Content: One of the best/ fresh thin crusted pizza in the city! They dont have a whole wheat pizza though, so they have room to improve)) however even a regular pizza is soooo good!!!

Reviews.Author: E H.
Reviews.Content: when i'm being a pizza snob and the average new york slice just doesn't cut it, i go to merilu, ditch out $5 for rectangular slice of whatever catches my eye first and carry on a little happier.. and heavier.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly H.
Reviews.Content: My first trip to NYC and I am so happy I followed the advice of fellow Yelpers and grabbed some pizza from Merilu! We stopped in about 45 minutes before close, so there weren't a ton of option for slices, but the guys working were happy to make us a pie of our own. We decided on our a half paddle of pepperoni, sausage, and basil. YUM! The crust was a little thicker than typical "new york style" which I am just fine with. The toppings were fresh and the sauce had a great flavor on its own. The smaller size was just right for the two of us - we were starved and we still had a slice or two left. Staff was friendly and made sure we were happy with our order. What more could a girl ask for? I will DEFINITELY be back next time I am in the city; I have been craving this pizza since I left!

Reviews.Author: Dominic L.
Reviews.Content: I've never written a rest. review before.  However, as an experienced Hell's Kitchen foodie, I can tell you this scent of Italy is very special to me.Does anyone remember the last pizzeria in this location?  Well, the place was a wreck, so I stopped coming.  Pizza quality was poor, the place was a mess, and employees were rude to me.Merilu & family have been a shining breath of fresh air.  Everyone enjoys working there and meeting customers.  And this shows in their artisanal & creative cooking.  Nice people + top-quality ingredients can ONLY create excellent dishes.There is a naivete to the owners.  Doing everything by the books, keeping the place beautiful and spotless;  never cheating on pure ingredients.  Don't they know they're supposed to be squeezing as much cash from their customers as possible!  Thankfully NO!Negatives, hmm...how about a better A/C system for the summer.  After all, they are in HELL's kitchen !Best of luck guys, you deserve it !

Reviews.Author: Ryan H.
Reviews.Content: Went to NYC for the weekend and sad to say that we found this place on our last day for our last meal.  The  pizza is AMAZING!!!  I had a slice of the Luciano Senor and it was to die for, great flavor with the ham, artichoke and olives.  We also had a slice of Margherita and Tims  pizza.  The crust is thin and crispy full or flavor!  This is a must!  Next time I am back in NYC this place is on my list to visit again!!!  We walked in around lunch time on Monday and there was only 1 other customer in the place.  We were a little skeptical but the reviews on here enticed us enough to give it a try, and glad we did!!

Reviews.Author: Jordan B.
Reviews.Content: So delicious and perfect for a post-show meal.  I hear they make their own mozzarella in house and it makes a difference.  On our trip down to NYC we enjoyed this place so much that we visited twice during the weekend!FYI, there aren't many tables inside, so either be lucky and snag a table or plan to take your pizza to go.

Reviews.Author: Peter P.
Reviews.Content: Best pizza we had for a long time. In addition the small pizza was this big that we took some home and it tasted even better on the next day.

Reviews.Author: Kevin O.
Reviews.Content: Best pizza I've had in NYC.  Its not traditional New York pizza, its gourmet, nice ingredients, great flavor, perfectly cooked.  I had the prosciutto with artichoke and olive slice and it blew me away.  $5.50 for that slice which easily fills you up and is worth every penny.  Most of the other slices are $4.

Reviews.Author: Mystery M.
Reviews.Content: The Death of the NY slice of Pizza?So my awesome fiancé suggested that we do a pizza tour.  Since our hotel was located in Midtown- West, we decided to hit up all the pizza spots we could find in one night.  The only caveat- they had to sell plain cheese slices.  Obviously any pizza parlor can make a great truffle oil/filetmignon/garlic/fig pizza.  But can they make a great cheese slice?  Needless to say, I won't be recommending NY pizza as boldly as I once did.  We ranked the pizzas on a basic scale, qualifying crust, sauce, cheese, tensile strength, and overall taste.  The results:1.) NY Pizzeria Suprema (great all around slice. Great sauce, great cheese, decent crust.  We had a bonus slice of the mozzarella/basil and it was one of the best slices ever).2.) Rosa's Pizza (decent slice, but not amazing.  Crust was good.  Our bonus slice of the buffalo chicken was far better.3.) Two Boots (we were very excited about this slice after some major disappointments, but the saucy was just too tangy and different to be a good NY slice.  Sauce wasn't marinara, but cheese and cornmeal crust were good.  Their fancy slices were pretty good looking though).4.) Fat Sal's (this one was decent, but didn't have as much taste as we expected.  Looked so much like a perfect NY slice that I almost cried after my first bite and was disappointed).5.) Sacco (another middle of the line slice.  Cheese was very good, sauce was non-existent).6.) Merilu (this one was a major disappointment.  I am sure their fancy slices are amazing, but the plain margarita was not anything special.  Sparse cheese, a very tangy sauce that was not flavorful, and a tasteless crust).  Definitely not a top 5 place.In conclusion, other than the fact that I want to throw up after all this pizza, I would have to say that if you are in the mood for a slice of pizza in midtown, other than Pizzeria Suprema, you're pretty much out of luck.  You're no worse off by just going to a $.99 pizza stall.

Reviews.Author: Christopher R.
Reviews.Content: Nothing to blow you away but they do a solid, rustic-style slice. If they have baby slices available they can sometimes be the best bang for your buck. I recommend the soppressata slice.

Reviews.Author: Jackie M.
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly great pizza. Nice variety of topped slices or pies.

Reviews.Author: Lauren W.
Reviews.Content: Best pizza in NY! Loved the flavor and the crust was perfect. Margherita was my fave. Sausage and mushroom was tasty too.  The service was great to go along with the food.  Great for a casual and quick drop in.

Reviews.Author: Dave B.
Reviews.Content: Visiting New York first thing I wanted was some pizza. I found this place near by on Yelp and the reviews were spot on. This place is amazing! We got a few slices of pepperoni and a chicken palm roll and it was one of the most savory lunches Ive had in ages. The girl at the counter was extremely friendly and helpful also. I have nothing but praise for this place. If you are in the mood for this type of food...here is one the best places to go. 5 stars!

Reviews.Author: Kai R.
Reviews.Content: This is a tiny pizza place (I counted 5 tables in total).  I suspect the bulk of their business is take out or delivery.  I agree with all of the other reviewers here on Yelp - very high quality, freshly made pizza.  May not be 100% NY authentic, but it still is thin crust and very tasty.  You can tell the folks here are passionate about their craft, and it shows.  Definitely check this place out.

Reviews.Author: Shatha A.
Reviews.Content: really tasty oven-brick Pizza go for the Mushroomthe Margherita is good too

Reviews.Author: Robert S.
Reviews.Content: Yum!

Reviews.Author: rich t.
Reviews.Content: love this place. i got the special pizza that had olives, ham, and onions on it... the crust is incredibly thin and crispy. it's awesome. if you are in the area... try one of the best thin crust pizzas I've had in awhile!

Reviews.Author: Blanca C.
Reviews.Content: Best pizza we tried in NYC. It was also our least expensive lunch.

Reviews.Author: Sparkely K.
Reviews.Content: I dropped off a load of laundry across the street and had time for a wee bit of pizza.  WOW!  Merilu pizza is yummy.  Great service - really friendly.  I am a true blue Chicago deep dish pizza gal but Merilu could convince me to switch sides!!

Reviews.Author: Robbie B.
Reviews.Content: Eh. Semi burnt ok slice. May try again.

Reviews.Author: Danielle H.
Reviews.Content: I thought this place was just ok.  I had the eggplant pizza.  The crust was too crispy for my tastes and I didn't think the cheese and sauce meshed well together.  However it was still better than your average pizza and fairly cheap.  I just expected more based on the reviews.  I did like that I was able to sit outside, though.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan P.
Reviews.Content: Good pizza coming from a NY pizza conisouir

Reviews.Author: Brian M.
Reviews.Content: Really good pizza. Ordered a large pepperoni for take out and it was ready within about 20 minutes. Crust was thin but not paper-thin and seemed to hold the semi-sweet sauce taste well. A little thin on the cheese spread but it works well and has a crispy taste with the crust and meat layout. The interior of the joint was clean, well-lit, and the people behind the counter were friendly. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Author: Luca C.
Reviews.Content: Delish, and didn't break the bank!  The staff was so nice there.  They gave me a free cup of hand-pitted olives to taste after I commented on a slice my friend got.  They also hooked me up with a little cup of marinara sauce to go with my garlic knots.  I hope I'm out this way again so I can get my Merilu on!

Reviews.Author: David C.
Reviews.Content: Best pizza I have had in NYC. Slice doesn't droop when folded, crust is just crisp enough and soft too. You can come for the plain cheese and be totally happy or try the several specialty options.  We had eggplant and marguerite as well as the cheese. Several seats inside - about 15 or so.

Reviews.Author: Shirley L.
Reviews.Content: We are San Diegans visiting New York... and we get it!! NEW YORK HAS THE BEST PIZZA!! :) Stumbled into Merilu's on our first night in town and the pizza lives up to the NYC reputation... crust... like heaven... toppings... light and flavorful... I'd give Merilu's 6 stars! Enjoyed it more than Grimaldi's (which we waited 1.5 hours in line for!!)

Reviews.Author: Jenny N.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic food and service. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: Minji K.
Reviews.Content: After recently moving to the neighborhood, I decided I wanted to try as many of the restaurants in the area, but I keep coming back to Merilu! Definitely some of the best pizza I've ever had, and as an added bonus, it doesn't come with the ridiculous long waits you see at other popular pizza joints (hooray for delivery, as there is not much seating inside the restaurant)! Delicious, thin, crispy crust, fresh mozzarella and other toppings, perfect amount of sauce. Nothing bad to say about this place.

Reviews.Author: Michelle M.
Reviews.Content: I live on park ave and love the food by me but anytime im on the west side i always come here. Its the best pizza in NYC and my guilty pleasure! I wouldnt eat from anywhere else. The owners are italian. They know how to make great pizza/food here. I pretty much tried most of the slices. You cant go wrong everything i tried has been delicious not a place i would hesitate trying different options. Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Cesar C.
Reviews.Content: I am really upset at the way they handle their mistakes. I called because I placed an order for a gluten free pizza and they put fried eggplant (not gluten free) on it and instead of accepting their mistake and replacing their order they blamed me for not reading the description even though I specified no gluten. They should have at least called me before delivering it. On top of that, they decided to pick it up and asked us to call seamless to get a reimbursement instead of doing an exchange for that mistake . Horrible costumer service by David. He even mentioned that there was not even a manager who I could address my concern to. It is upsetting that in such a great city, customer service can still be questionable. Perhaps their waiters can memorize the menu and call if there is an issue instead of just sending an incorrect order. Be careful if you have any allergy because if you do and don't "read" the description, even though you specified your allergies, you will be held responsible for it. It's the only place where I have had any issues with this and on top of making the mistake, NOT BEING CAPABLE of replacing the item for another one that meets the requirements of your needs.

Reviews.Author: Ella P.
Reviews.Content: pros: delicious pizzaexcellent, crispy thin crustsells by the slice (this is kind of like lazarra's by the slice version)sweet saucebest pizza by the slice pizza in hells kitchen, without a doubtcons:not enough cheese not enough basil on margheritaa bit too expensive per slice

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey S.
Reviews.Content: Merilu's is a small pizza place with seating for about 18 people.  We were a party of eight and we squeezed in.  We ordered a large pizza Fresca and a Rustica Pizza.  They were both excellent.  It was our only pizza in New York but it was as good a pizza as we have ever had.  Both pizzas used fresh ingredients and had a delicious thin crust.  We'll be using this as our bench mark for best pizzas from now on.  Also, the staff was very friendly and accommodating with our large group.

Reviews.Author: Rob K.
Reviews.Content: Hmm. Can't believe this has such a high rating. Not too bad but nothing great. Sauce bland. Crust too cracker-like for my taste

Reviews.Author: Brett W.
Reviews.Content: Guess I'm just not an "al metro" guy... I even tried a second slice (of their most popular one, margherita) just to make sure it wasn't me. Yes, this is good pizza. But I honestly don't see why it gets so many 5-star reviews. Maybe because the staff is so friendly...

Reviews.Author: Jasmeet Singh D.
Reviews.Content: Pizza was good. But there was no system in meat and veg pizza's on display. When ordering single slices, don't get to many slices at once. They get cold to fast and that's sad because they taste good. Missing the 2 stars because you shouldn't go here if you just want reguler simple pizza's.

Reviews.Author: Dung N.
Reviews.Content: Since we had an extra day in NY, we had more time to explore other restaurants lol. This place had good reviews and our friend recommended it, so we headed over there...It felt like such a long walk! I didn't know it was one of those places where you just pick the pizza slices that were already made. There was only one left of the one I wanted, but the cut it in half, so it's more like 2 slices. :) It was really good, thin, and salty. :)

Reviews.Author: Linus W.
Reviews.Content: First stop looking for quick eats down 9th ave.  Although the pre-made pizzas may not look that appealing, they reheat it before serving.  The taste is good for the price - ~$5 gets you a big piece of thin crust, nothing fancy, but nice and crispy.  Probably not a whole meal for a guy, but it'll get you more than half way there!  (I still prefer my yuppy thincrust in SF, though. :)

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth J.
Reviews.Content: Had Pizza here last week with my sister. Awesome garden salad to start, big portion, perfect to share.  We had the grilled eggplant pizza, super healthy cooked perfectly.  Almost felt too healthy to be a pizza.  The crust was perfectly cooked.  Awesome veggie options.

Reviews.Author: Alex P.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely one if the best delivery pizza places the city. I grew up in Bensonhurst eating L&B (just saying). The pizza from Merilu is delicious and is always delivered  crispy and piping hot. Pizza consistency and texture are excellent, thin crust and never too much oil or sauce. The classic staples like the margarita are excellent, but if you like salt try the anchovie/caper combination, its very unusual.

Reviews.Author: Andrew K.
Reviews.Content: Offered me an old, dried out slice. When I pointed that out the response was: "Oh, it's just a little dry". Are you kidding me?

Reviews.Author: Michelle D.
Reviews.Content: Very yummy pizza. And they have a huge selection of pies and single servings

Reviews.Author: Sandra M.
Reviews.Content: Just plain awesome.

Reviews.Author: Karol S.
Reviews.Content: This review is for delivery of their pizza and pasta so maybe that explains the discrepancy between my 3-star review and all the other 5-star ones.  The pizza was extremely average and the baked ziti was just a-ok.  Not terrible but merely passable.

Reviews.Author: Onno K.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING. Everything a pizza should be. Light. Crisp. Flavorful. Fresh ingredients. And the service was the best part. Family owned. Maggie was great!

Reviews.Author: Dean K.
Reviews.Content: Awesome awesome pizza.  My daughter and I had the 15" rustica with a BLT salad which was just about right.  It's a rectangular pizza so the size is a little difficult to gauge without seeing it.  I loved the crust - thin and delicious.  Next time I would like to try the calzone - I think their dough would be perfect for it.

Reviews.Author: Ruth W.
Reviews.Content: may i just say i miss this place a lot? and that i've discussed flying back to NY just to stop in? It's so good. I'm glad to see they are still doing well:)

Reviews.Author: David H.
Reviews.Content: I really liked the pizza here, even though it's a bit pricey.. The selection is great and for two of us, we shared each got one slice and then shared one more.. plenty of food for us!  The pizza is rectangular, so the slices are square, which makes them easy to handle even for younger fingers.  The dining area is very small, so depending on how crowded it is, be prepared to "take out."

Reviews.Author: Woody N.
Reviews.Content: Looks like a hole in the wall, but it is a treasure trove of pizza perfection! Merilu and her daughter are sweet, cute and talented.

Reviews.Author: J J.
Reviews.Content: Delicious!  Thank goodness for Yelp on my Droid!  My daughter and I were starving on our way to the firework show and stopped in for amazing thin and crispy pizza.  YUM!!

Reviews.Author: Ben E.
Reviews.Content: One of the best things to happen to Midtown West in awhile.  It has been a struggle to find a good pie here -- until Merilu showed up!  Do yourself a favor and check them out!

Reviews.Author: Laura H.
Reviews.Content: This pizza was great and cheap. You have to spend at least $10 to pay with credit card. I got the sausage pizza and it was yummy!

Reviews.Author: Jones B.
Reviews.Content: It's good pizza, good crust, good cheese, small shop, not bad at all.

Reviews.Author: George S.
Reviews.Content: Very good pizza. Had the pepperoni, tomato and basil, and eggplant, all three were tasty. Prices are very reasonable, service was very good. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Author: Steve A.
Reviews.Content: Very good pizza and nice welcome with the Italian style !

Reviews.Author: Constance Z.
Reviews.Content: WOW thanks fellow yelpers this place was amazing!  It is a family business and you feel that as soon as you walk in.  My BF is a pain about eating out and he was hesitant at first since there were not many tables and it is BYOB.  We stayed and it was amazing!  It is not just a pizza place it also has chicken dishes.  He kept saying that this was the best food he had in years.   Everything is made daily and is fresh.  The pizza reminds me of when I went to Naples.  The service was great they couldn't do enough to please us, more grated cheese no problem.  Prices are really reasonable, what a treat!

Reviews.Author: Marcos S.
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the pizza here!  It's some of the best slices I've had in my life, bar none.  Originally from NY, I come to visit the big apple a few times a year  and my priority is to try new pizzerias.  I'm thankful that I ran into Merilu!!  My favorite is the Margarita slice.  The cheese was perfectly heated, the crust crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  Like some reviewers have said, THE SAUCE is amazing.  I wish they had good pizza in LA.  But the next time I visit NYC, Merilu will be the first stop!!

Reviews.Author: Marlin P.
Reviews.Content: Was at the Library bar @ the Hudson with a few co-workers and started searching yelp for a bite to eat.  Wasn't about to spend insane money for sushi or on any of the french joints in the area and came across the reviews for Merilu.  Have to say it did not disappoint.  Staff was very friendly, relatively small place but for the time we rolled in it wasn't very crowded so we were able to get seating without a problem.  Sampled a variety of slices and the eggplant is absolutely fantastic.  Pretty sure we will end up making a return visit before heading back home

Reviews.Author: B S.
Reviews.Content: Awesome pizza! Great price also!

Reviews.Author: Maggie M.
Reviews.Content: First time in NY and my first pizza here!! It's a cute little place and the pizza is artisan. We got the eggplant rolls and could have only eaten those! They were delicious! Loved it and the service was great! Definitely would go back! Thanks!

Reviews.Author: Arvind A.
Reviews.Content: Seems like the pizza quality has dropped a bit, but it still better than all the other places in the area.

Reviews.Author: Aaron P.
Reviews.Content: Simplicity, many times, can carry an experience further than layering on 'the good things' ad nauseam. Merilu has it down.  Simple pies served quick with nice service behind the glass.  I had 2 slices, was asked if I "wanted an end piece or a middle."  The pizza was perfection.  Must've been made from the freshest of ingredients.  You could definitely tell care had been taken in the thought that put this petite eatery together.  Go here and you'll like it.

Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: Wow the food was amazing. Try your best to endure the waiting time though because it does take time to make completely fresh pizza for each customer. For me it was a little difficult because it was scorching hot for the whole day and this place was not very cool since heat does come from the kitchen. Trust me, though. It's worth the wait. It pizza was so amazing and you could tell that all of its ingredients were fresh. My family and I CLEANED the plate. There was nothing left. That's how good it was. Please don't settle for the other pizza places around there. Just because its a pizza place in New York does NOT mean its going to be good.

Reviews.Author: Joy N.
Reviews.Content: Awesome!

Reviews.Author: Patricia B.
Reviews.Content: Excellent pizza!   Nice, clean atmosphere.  It is clear to see that this family takes real pride in their creations with authentic fresh ingredients cooked to perfection ...and a great value for a fair price!

Reviews.Author: robert s.
Reviews.Content: Wow one of the best pizza I ever had

Reviews.Author: Stuart C.
Reviews.Content: Good crust, good quality ingredients.  However, overall B flavor.  Ambience is very poor.

Reviews.Author: Pat S.
Reviews.Content: I placed an order for pickup last night.  By far, some of the best service I have received in NY.   The lady i spoke with asked detailed questions about how I would like the toppings on my pizza.  She also called me back 10 minutes before the order would be ready so I could pick it up fresh out of the oven.   The toppings were fresh (and a lot of them), the garlic knots were fresh and very good.  Reasonable price, about $22 for a small pizza with 2 toppings, 2 orders of garlic knots and 2 sodas.   Living only a few blocks from here, I will make this my local pizza joint.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Craig D.
Reviews.Content: Great Pizza!!!  Went for a bit to eat after a show and this place was a terrific find.

Reviews.Author: Brett B.
Reviews.Content: The place is very small, but has Fantastic pizza.  Great sauce and crust.  And the workers were very warm and friendly.  Definitely plan to go back with I am in NYC.

Reviews.Author: Jesse C.
Reviews.Content: Myself & the kids loved the pizza here. Wonderfully crispy crust & great toppings. We will definitely come back the next time we make it to NYC.There aren't too many tables, but we happened to come by on a sunny day. We snagged the table closest to the front -- almost on the sidewalk. Made it a wonderful experience, a nice relaxing lunch eating pizza & people watching

Reviews.Author: chil k.
Reviews.Content: Good pizza at a really good price for NYC, but not all ingredients are as fresh as they say they are. However, if you want quick slices and are near there you won't be disappointed

Reviews.Author: Gail H.
Reviews.Content: margherita:* excellent crust * sauce could've been sweeter* wish the basil wasn't dried out and flavorless

Reviews.Author: Brian T.
Reviews.Content: We had the sopressata and margherita. The sopressata was spicy and smokey, very good. The margherita was excellent. The crust was thin, light, and crunchy. We would definitely eat here again.

Reviews.Author: Little H.
Reviews.Content: Honestly not very good. Old pizza sitting out thats reheated. I'd rather go down the street.

Reviews.Author: Raymond G.
Reviews.Content: Fresh pizza with interesting toppings.  $4 specialty slices, $2.50 plain.  Good pizza, not great.  Slices are a bit small.

Reviews.Author: Chris P.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING pizza!  We ate in, only a few tables with no waitstaff but nonetheless the staff was super friendly and the food was fantastic.  We would absolutely return!

Reviews.Author: E D.
Reviews.Content: Pizza is amazing.  Crust is perfect...sauce is fantastic.  Ingredients are fresh.  These people just get it.  Staff is extremely friendly.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Author: Ron M.
Reviews.Content: Visited for the first time on January 21, a Saturday, late afternoon.Had one piece each of the primavera and prosciutto arugula.Excellent! Crust, sauce, cheeses, and other toppings were all great.And when asked if I wanted something to drink, I requested a cup of water, which was provided no problem. Maybe not a big deal, but it's been my experience that certain businesses would rather sell you a bottled water.(I made the mistake of accepting the bottled water at a competing pizza place, only to discover that the bottled water was more expensive than the slice of pizza.)My only complaint about Merilu: I came back the next day, on Sunday, my last day in the city during my current trip, and they were closed! Wish I'd discovered them earlier in the week.

Reviews.Author: Brenda S.
Reviews.Content: Delicious, fresh and perfectly thin - everything was fantastic here, we can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Author: Marianne G.
Reviews.Content: I steppen into this pizzeria today and I have to say that this is certainly by far one of the best pizzas I have ever had...and I have lived here for many many years!!!!The Margarita was off the hook and I was asked if I wanted fresh grated cheese too!They take care of their first timers for sure...

Reviews.Author: Hanna S.
Reviews.Content: Best pizza ever!!! Nice clean spot in Hells kitchen tastiest NY style pizza ever!!!!

Reviews.Author: Matt M.
Reviews.Content: Last September, I called Merilu with a specific request, two pizzas that had to be delivered (one large, one medium) in under 45 minutes for my friends and me. I made this specific request because I was leaving New York City after 5 years to live abroad and my plane was leaving soon. When the lady on the other end of the phone heard my story she promised me she would get it done.Sure enough they got both the pies over in about 40 minutes, and even left me a note wishing me luck and safety on my journey. The delivery man was even panting a bit because he had rode his bike over extra fast. These are the moments that make me love New York so much. I have always thought their Italian style pizzas were the best in hells kitchen. I want to assure the good people of NYC that their commitment to their customers is the same!Thank you Merilu! You and your staff are truly outstanding! Your pizza's speak for themselves, I would give you six stars for your service if I could!

Reviews.Author: Liza Z.
Reviews.Content: Love this tiny joint. A no-frills pizzeria serving the best pizza in town. Beautiful thin crust with flavorful sauce and fresh mozzarella. Yelp says it's BYOB, too!!

Reviews.Author: Arielle b.
Reviews.Content: I came here for the first time a few days ago. The pizza was amazing! The place had an awesome vibe as well, perfect music to dine to!

Reviews.Author: the asian jedi ..
Reviews.Content: amazing freaking buffalo chicken pizza. i die.

Reviews.Author: Andrea D.
Reviews.Content: Great Pizza! nice and casual. Friendly service, and nice music.

Reviews.Author: Tim C.
Reviews.Content: This place is tops inHell's Kitchen. The whole family is there cooking for you.  And they love to do it. Skip Ray's, skip Lazzara's and go Merilu's.

Reviews.Author: garrick g.
Reviews.Content: A charming hole in the wall with friendly staff and wonderfully perfect pizza.  The wife and I stopped in prior to a show after reading about it here.  The pizza more than makes up for any shortcomings in the random decor.  One of the guys behind the counter even started offering me tips on how to improve my own pizza!

Reviews.Author: S P.
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I've lived around the corner for almost two years and never ordered from here. Simply one of the best pizza places I've been to. Very consistent and fresh. Crust is the perfect combination of crispy and soft. Delivery is quick. Merilu is a must go.

Reviews.Author: Gina K.
Reviews.Content: Just moved to NYC for the summer and have had Merilu's excellent pizza twice . . . I'm from Chicago (a pizza town) and have lived in a number of other cities and have never had anything like a Merilu pizza . . . all homemade ingredients, amazing crust . . . truly excellent pizza.

Reviews.Author: Kevin L.
Reviews.Content: ive gotten food poisoning from this place, found hair in the garlic bread, and felt bloated/nauseous after eating here, but i still order it anyway because it's so damn good.

Reviews.Author: Melissa W.
Reviews.Content: We tried lots of pizza on this trip.  Merilu's margarita pizza was my favorite!  It was so good that I asked my husband to get me a 2nd slice!

Reviews.Author: Yesi T.
Reviews.Content: Just finished eating my first pizza from Merilu's and all I can say is FANTASTIC!!! You have to try it for yourself, you'll be so happy you did.

Reviews.Author: Bhavini P.
Reviews.Content: Merilu pizza is so good we went twice in one day! The crust is thin and perfectly light and crispy without tasting burnt! The slices also were saucy and not overly cheesy. Try the margarita with mushrooms!

Reviews.Author: Darren P.
Reviews.Content: Went here on our first night in the city. Not as good, but better than we remembered. We all shared a pizza which was to die for, can't remember the name of it,  but it came with Chicken, Bacon, Mozz cheese, hot wing sauce, ranch dressing, the hottest jalapeno peppers I think I ever ate in my life. The only think that was missing was a cold beer. But the good news you can go to the end of the block ( about 5 doors down) and get some beer and take it in with you. THIS IS THE BEST PIZZA IN NEW YORK CITY so make it a point to eat here. It is on 9th ave between 52nd & 53rd streets. Family owned and operated, Mom in the back ( who by the way the place is named after) and the son cooking the pies. WE LOVE YOUR PIZZA & WE WILL BE BACK.

Reviews.Author: Robert W.
Reviews.Content: We're from Boston, which has some pretty great pizza joints, so we were very optimistic when, after having read the reviews on Yelp, we decided to try Merilu.  We were not disappointed!  When.we first arrived all of the five tables were taken, but we ordered anyway, taking a chance that by the time our pizza was ready, a table would become available.  Oh yes, "so how was the pizza?", you ask.  Delicious.  We chose the Rustica, which has sausage and roasted red peppers.  The crust was just thick enough to hold the ingredients and very flavorful.  It is not round, but rectangular, and served piping hot on a wooden pallet fresh from the oven.  Merilu offers many different varieties of pizza, so there is something to please everybody.  If you're anywhere near 53rd and 9th you should try it.  It's worth the trip.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie T.
Reviews.Content: just a short walk from times square, this was a great yelp find. 3.50 for a medium slice of magherita pizza, 5 for speciality slices. fresh cheese and sauce, crispy crust. would have been 5 stars if the crust had been cooked a bit less. cute decor.

Reviews.Author: George L.
Reviews.Content: A little pricey but excellent, fresh and delicious.

Reviews.Author: Steve L.
Reviews.Content: Great great pizza. I look forward to trying more of their stuff. So far, recommend the getting Margherita or mushroom.

Reviews.Author: David F.
Reviews.Content: I never, ever review restaurants on Yelp, but I'm making an exception. This pizza place is incredibly good. This is as good as pizza gets in my opinion. I tried four slices while there. Each one had a thin crust, delicious fresh cheese, home made tomatos sauce, and toppings you could actually taste. The service was unbelievably kind and welcoming. They suggested slices and were simply nice to chat with. The atmosphere was warm and smelled like pizza just the way it should. If you live near here, or even if you don't, this is a place to check out.

Reviews.Author: Chris K.
Reviews.Content: A very nice New York pizzeria with some interesting twists.  Thin crust vegetarian and meat pizza.  Salads are OK, but the pizza is very tasty.  A bit more expensive than the giant New York slices you find at the usual joints.  Trust the reviews, it's pretty darn good.

Reviews.Author: p. l.
Reviews.Content: Seriously, this is good pizza.  I've eaten at expensive pizza joints (prior to 2008), now I have to watch my budget (it's a recession).  But this is the best pizza I've eaten (ok, Artichoke is pretty good too).  But when you're in Midtown and too lazy to take the subway, this is the place to go.  To owners of Merilu, please don't let the good reviews get to you, because many a places have done this, and it never turns out too well!  Keep up with what you're doing, that's all we ask!

Reviews.Author: Richard O.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best Pizza in Hells Kitchen!! The "Americano" is one of the best sandwiches I"ve ever had. Bread is fresh and the salads are great as well! As you can see I"m a fan!

Reviews.Author: Nicole H.
Reviews.Content: This place is incredible.  Looking for the best pizza in NYC?  Look no further.  Their crust is incredibly thin and crispy while the toppings are totally perfect, fresh, and delicious.  The owners are about as nice and personable as they come.  I would never go anywhere else for pizza!

Reviews.Author: Ken S.
Reviews.Content: Excellent pizza.  These guys have clearly put some thought into their sauce and crust. This may be my go-to neighborhood pizza joint.

Reviews.Author: Sandro F.
Reviews.Content: Esse lugar foi uma bela descoberta, provavelmente uma das melhores pizzas que já comi. Concordo com os reviews que indicam como a melhor pizza de NY! A massa é fina e muito crocante (surpreendente pois é feita em forno elétrico), a cobertura é fresca e deliciosa e o molho de tomate é suave. Pedimos uma Margherita with fresh tomatoes, 4 slices size, pensando que seria apenas o suficiente para a fome do casal, mas era enorme. Deu pena de não conseguirmos comer tudo... Não servem álcool no local, que é pequeno e muito simples com poucas mesas. É mais uma delivery do que uma pizzaria. Os donos são uma família de italianos do brooklyn, todos muito simpáticos. Adoramos e vamos voltar antes de retornar ao Brasil.

Reviews.Author: Jim D.
Reviews.Content: Great thin crust pie.  The margarita and the white pizza were terrific.

Reviews.Author: Peter S.
Reviews.Content: What a great place on a hot summer evening in expensive Times Square! Pizza is both unique (salami sausage was fantastic) and affordable (4 of us ate for ~$45). My teenaged boys wanted to go back, so in a 4 day trip, we ate at Merilu twice! Interesting toppings, incredible crust, and reasonable prices should make this a must-stop location for vacationers and locals alike. A little haven in the crazy theatre district.

Reviews.Author: Julie A.
Reviews.Content: Great pizza!  Crisp crust even w lots of toppings. Good, tasty sauce.  We will go back next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Author: Greg H.
Reviews.Content: The pizza here is good if you like thin crust pizza.  It wasn't undercooked or burned.  The place was pretty small, with only 4 or 5 tables.

Reviews.Author: Dani L.
Reviews.Content: OMG!!! this is the best pizza in NYC. The crust is awesome and the toppings are fresh. I had family in from the west coast and they wanted to eat at Merilu's every single day.  In addition to the friendly and helpful staff...I went in for a pick up and it started to rain heavily....the delivery guy drove me bake to my apt out a courtesy....now that's a neighbor you want for life! Congrats and welcome to the neighborhood.

Reviews.Author: Matt S.
Reviews.Content: really solid pizza.  people who work there are very nice.  i like the buffalo when they have it.  sometimes some of the crazy topping slices can be a bit much, but all their toppings taste really good.  mushroom here is also a winner
